CVE-2024-43461
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.71%

updated 2024-09-17T11:17:22.597000

31 posts

Windows MSHTML Platform Spoofing Vulnerability

screaminggoat at 2024-09-16T14:49:10.331Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Two Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
This is so hot off of the press that CISA hasn't started making the CISA alert yet.

  • CVE-2024-43461 (8.8 high, disclosed 10 September 2024 by Microsoft during Patch Tuesday) Windows MSHTML Platform Spoofing Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-6670 (9.8 critical, disclosed 16 August 2024 by Progress Software, has proof of concept) Progress WhatsUp Gold SQL Injection Vulnerability

#cisa #kev #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2024_43461 #microsoft #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #CVE_2024_6670 #proofofconcept #whatsupgold #progress

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-14T13:37:04.122Z ##
  • CISA adding Ivanti to the KEV on a Friday (CVE-2024-8190) https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/09/13/cisa-adds-one-known-exploited-vulnerability-catalog
  • Microsoft updating Windows MSHTML Platform Spoofing Vulnerability CVE-2024-43461 to a publicly disclosed exploited zero-day on Friday evening https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-43461

#CVE_2024_8190 #CVE_2024_43461 #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #KEV #CISA #Microsoft #vulnerability #Ivanti

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-14T03:18:28.646Z ##

Microsoft Security Response Center (MSRC) corrected CVE-2024-43461 (8.8 high) Windows MSHTML Platform Spoofing Vulnerability, marking it as both exploited and publicly disclosed based on evidence of exploitation from ZDI Hunting Team (see parent toot). This is the fifth zero day of September 2024 Patch Tuesday!
cc: @TheDustinChilds @campuscodi @briankrebs @todb @goatyell @ntkramer @hrbrmstr

#CVE_2024_43461 #eitw #activeexploitation #vulnerability #microsoft #msrc #zeroday #cve

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-10T18:40:13.613Z ##

Zero Day Initiative: The September 2024 Security Update Review
Trend Micro and Zero Day Initiative dispute Microsoft's security advisory for CVE-2024-43461 (8.8 high) Windows MSHTML Platform Spoofing Vulnerability, stating that it is being actively exploited in the wild:

This bug is similar to the vulnerability we reported and was patched back in July. The ZDI Threat Hunting team discovered this exploit in the wild and reported it to Microsoft back in June. It appears threat actors quickly bypassed the previous patch. When we told Microsoft about the bug, we indicated it was being actively used. We’re not sure why they don’t list it as being under active attack, but you should treat it as though it were, especially since it affects all supported versions of Windows.

If Trend Micro/ZDI contacts Microsoft to get it changed, we may see this advisory updated. CISA would also likely add it to the KEV Catalog.

h/t: @TheDustinChilds

#CVE_2024_43461 #microsoft #vulnerability #eitw #cve #activeexploitation #kev #microsoft #patchtuesday

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-16T14:49:10.000Z ##

This is so hot off of the press that CISA hasn't started making the CISA alert yet.

  • CVE-2024-43461 (8.8 high, disclosed 10 September 2024 by Microsoft during Patch Tuesday) Windows MSHTML Platform Spoofing Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-6670 (9.8 critical, disclosed 16 August 2024 by Progress Software, has proof of concept) Progress WhatsUp Gold SQL Injection Vulnerability

Zero Day Initiative: The September 2024 Security Update Review
Trend Micro and Zero Day Initiative dispute Microsoft's security advisory for CVE-2024-43461 (8.8 high) Windows MSHTML Platform Spoofing Vulnerability, stating that it is being actively exploited in the wild:

This bug is similar to the vulnerability we reported and was patched back in July. The ZDI Threat Hunting team discovered this exploit in the wild and reported it to Microsoft back in June. It appears threat actors quickly bypassed the previous patch. When we told Microsoft about the bug, we indicated it was being actively used. We’re not sure why they don’t list it as being under active attack, but you should treat it as though it were, especially since it affects all supported versions of Windows.

If Trend Micro/ZDI contacts Microsoft to get it changed, we may see this advisory updated. CISA would also likely add it to the KEV Catalog.

h/t: @TheDustinChilds

Zero Day Initiative: The September 2024 Security Update Review
Trend Micro and Zero Day Initiative dispute Microsoft's security advisory for CVE-2024-43461 (8.8 high) Windows MSHTML Platform Spoofing Vulnerability, stating that it is being actively exploited in the wild:

This bug is similar to the vulnerability we reported and was patched back in July. The ZDI Threat Hunting team discovered this exploit in the wild and reported it to Microsoft back in June. It appears threat actors quickly bypassed the previous patch. When we told Microsoft about the bug, we indicated it was being actively used. We’re not sure why they don’t list it as being under active attack, but you should treat it as though it were, especially since it affects all supported versions of Windows.

If Trend Micro/ZDI contacts Microsoft to get it changed, we may see this advisory updated. CISA would also likely add it to the KEV Catalog.

Trend Micro and Zero Day Initiative dispute Microsoft's security advisory for CVE-2024-43461 (8.8 high) Windows MSHTML Platform Spoofing Vulnerability, stating that it is being actively exploited in the wild:

This bug is similar to the vulnerability we reported and was patched back in July. The ZDI Threat Hunting team discovered this exploit in the wild and reported it to Microsoft back in June. It appears threat actors quickly bypassed the previous patch. When we told Microsoft about the bug, we indicated it was being actively used. ##
iulianvostrut@mastodon.social at 2024-09-17T09:54:13.000Z ##

Microsoft has confirmed active exploitation of CVE-2024-43461, a critical MSHTML spoofing flaw, leading to the delivery of Atlantida stealer malware. This marks the fourth zero-day patched by Microsoft this month. Stay vigilant and update your systems promptly.

##

CVE-2024-6670
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 95.63%

updated 2024-09-17T01:00:01.320000

13 posts

In WhatsUp Gold versions released before 2024.0.0, a SQL Injection vulnerability allows an unauthenticated attacker to retrieve the users encrypted password.

Nuclei template

1 repos

https://github.com/sinsinology/CVE-2024-6670

screaminggoat at 2024-09-16T14:49:10.331Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Two Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
This is so hot off of the press that CISA hasn't started making the CISA alert yet.

  • CVE-2024-43461 (8.8 high, disclosed 10 September 2024 by Microsoft during Patch Tuesday) Windows MSHTML Platform Spoofing Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-6670 (9.8 critical, disclosed 16 August 2024 by Progress Software, has proof of concept) Progress WhatsUp Gold SQL Injection Vulnerability

#cisa #kev #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2024_43461 #microsoft #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #CVE_2024_6670 #proofofconcept #whatsupgold #progress

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-12T15:28:35.183Z ##

Trend Micro: Protecting Against RCE Attacks Abusing WhatsUp Gold Vulnerabilities
Trend Micro reports possible exploitation of CVE-2024-6670 and CVE-2024-6671 (both 9.8 critical, disclosed 16 August 2024 by Progress Software, has proofs of concept and technical vulnerability analysis from reporter) in WhatsUp Gold. Attacks began almost immediately upon release of the POC, and observed attacks abused NmPoller.exe to execute PowerShell scripts to download various remote access tools. Indicators of compromise provided.

#threatintel #whatsupgold #CVE_2024_6670 #CVE_2024_6671 #IOC #proofofconcept #POC #infosec #cybersecurity

##

  • CVE-2024-6670 (9.8 critical, disclosed 16 August 2024 by Progress Software, has proof of concept) Progress WhatsUp Gold SQL Injection Vulnerability

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-12T15:28:35.000Z ##

Trend Micro: Protecting Against RCE Attacks Abusing WhatsUp Gold Vulnerabilities
Trend Micro reports possible exploitation of CVE-2024-6670 and CVE-2024-6671 (both 9.8 critical, disclosed 16 August 2024 by Progress Software, has proofs of concept and technical vulnerability analysis from reporter) in WhatsUp Gold. Attacks began almost immediately upon release of the POC, and observed attacks abused NmPoller.exe to execute PowerShell scripts to download various remote access tools. Indicators of compromise provided.

#threatintel #whatsupgold #CVE_2024_6670 #CVE_2024_6671 #IOC #proofofconcept #POC #infosec #cybersecurity

##
patchnow24x7 at 2024-09-17T11:47:53.517Z ##

Update :
CISA has added CVE-2024-6670 to its 'Known Exploited vulnerabilities catalog'. IF YOU HAVEN'T PATCHED IT YET, PATCH IT NOW!!

Link: https://cisa.gov/known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog

CVE-2024-28990
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-09-16T18:05:28.957000

6 posts

SolarWinds Access Rights Manager (ARM) was found to contain a hard-coded credential authentication bypass vulnerability. If exploited, this vulnerability would allow access to the RabbitMQ management console. We thank Trend Micro Zero Day Initiative (ZDI) for its ongoing partnership in coordinating with SolarWinds on responsible disclosure of this and other potential vulnerabilities.

📬 Sicherheitslücken in SolarWinds: Sofortiges Update empfohlen
#Datenschutz #ITSicherheit #CVE202428990 #CVE202428991 #Sicherheitslücke #SolarWinds #Update #ZDI https://sc.tarnkappe.info/f0780b

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-13T14:05:06.095Z ##

SolarWinds: SolarWinds Access Rights Manager (ARM) Deserialization of Untrusted Data Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (CVE-2024-28991)
CVE-2024-28991 (9.0 critical, disclosed 12 September 2024) SolarWinds Access Rights Manager (ARM) was found to be susceptible to a remote code execution vulnerability. If exploited, this vulnerability would allow an authenticated user to abuse the service, resulting in remote code execution.
Reported by Piotr Bazydlo (@chudypb) of Trend Micro Zero Day Initiative. No mention of exploitation.

EDIT: Piotr states that CVE-2024-28991 can be chained with CVE-2024-28990 (6.3 medium) SolarWinds Access Rights Manager (ARM) Hardcoded Credentials Authentication Bypass Vulnerability for pre-authenticated remote code execution.

#solarwinds #vulnerability #CVE_2024_28991 #cve

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-13T14:05:06.000Z ##

SolarWinds: SolarWinds Access Rights Manager (ARM) Deserialization of Untrusted Data Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (CVE-2024-28991)
CVE-2024-28991 (9.0 critical, disclosed 12 September 2024) SolarWinds Access Rights Manager (ARM) was found to be susceptible to a remote code execution vulnerability. If exploited, this vulnerability would allow an authenticated user to abuse the service, resulting in remote code execution.
Reported by Piotr Bazydlo (@chudypb) of Trend Micro Zero Day Initiative. No mention of exploitation.

EDIT: Piotr states that CVE-2024-28991 can be chained with CVE-2024-28990 (6.3 medium) SolarWinds Access Rights Manager (ARM) Hardcoded Credentials Authentication Bypass Vulnerability for pre-authenticated remote code execution.

#solarwinds #vulnerability #CVE_2024_28991 #cve

CVE-2024-45695
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-09-16T14:53:48

2 posts

The web service of certain models of D-Link wireless routers contains a Stack-based Buffer Overflow vulnerability, which allows unauthenticated remote attackers to exploit this vulnerability to execute arbitrary code on the device.

verbrecher@mastodon.social at 2024-09-16T20:36:48.000Z ##

New:

🚨 CVSS 9.8 for D-Link WiFi Routers: Update Your Firmware Immediately

🛡️ Critical vulnerabilities have been discovered in several D-Link router models, potentially exposing millions of users to major security risks. TWCERT/CC, Taiwan's cybersecurity agency, urges all users to update their firmware without delay to avoid remote control of their devices.

Vulns:

CVE-2024-45694 (CVSS 9.8)
CVE-2024-45698 (CVSS 8.8)
CVE-2024-45697 (CVSS 9.8)
CVE-2024-45695 (CVSS 9.8)
CVE-2024-45696 (CVSS 8.8)

##
verbrecher@mastodon.social at 2024-09-16T20:36:48.000Z ##

##

CVE-2024-45696
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-09-16T14:52:40

2 posts

Certain models of D-Link wireless routers contain hidden functionality. By sending specific packets to the web service, the attacker can forcibly enable the telnet service and log in using hard-coded credentials. The telnet service enabled through this method can only be accessed from within the same local network as the device.

verbrecher@mastodon.social at 2024-09-16T20:36:48.000Z ##

New:

🚨 CVSS 9.8 for D-Link WiFi Routers: Update Your Firmware Immediately

🛡️ Critical vulnerabilities have been discovered in several D-Link router models, potentially exposing millions of users to major security risks. TWCERT/CC, Taiwan's cybersecurity agency, urges all users to update their firmware without delay to avoid remote control of their devices.

Vulns:

CVE-2024-45694 (CVSS 9.8)
CVE-2024-45698 (CVSS 8.8)
CVE-2024-45697 (CVSS 9.8)
CVE-2024-45695 (CVSS 9.8)
CVE-2024-45696 (CVSS 8.8)

##
verbrecher@mastodon.social at 2024-09-16T20:36:48.000Z ##

CVE-2024-45697
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-09-16T14:52:37

2 posts

Certain models of D-Link wireless routers have a hidden functionality where the telnet service is enabled when the WAN port is plugged in. Unauthorized remote attackers can log in and execute OS commands using hard-coded credentials.

##

CVE-2024-45698
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-09-16T14:52:37

2 posts

Certain models of D-Link wireless routers do not properly validate user input in the telnet service, allowing unauthenticated remote attackers to use hard-coded credentials to log into telnet and inject arbitrary OS commands, which can then be executed on the device.

CVE-2024-8190
(7.2 HIGH)

EPSS: 15.12%

updated 2024-09-16T13:44:18.173000

33 posts

An OS command injection vulnerability in Ivanti Cloud Services Appliance versions 4.6 Patch 518 and before allows a remote authenticated attacker to obtain remote code execution. The attacker must have admin level privileges to exploit this vulnerability.

1 repos

https://github.com/horizon3ai/CVE-2024-8190

screaminggoat at 2024-09-16T15:34:57.864Z ##

Horizon3: CVE-2024-8190: Investigating CISA KEV Ivanti Cloud Service Appliance Command Injection Vulnerability
See parent toots above for information and links to Ivanti's Cloud Services Appliance OS command injection vulnerability CVE-2024-8190, I'm too lazy to link them repeatedly.

@hacks_zach of Horizon3 takes a closer look at CVE-2024-8190, going from patch diffing to double-checking that this is an authenticated vulnerability. He writes "We theorize that most likely users who have been exploited have never logged in to the appliance, or due to lack of rate limiting may have had poor password hygiene and had weaker passwords."

#CVE_2024_8190 #Ivanti #vulnerability #IvantiCSA #eitw #activeexploitation #kev #CISA #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #zeroday #CVE

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-14T13:37:04.122Z ##
  • CISA adding Ivanti to the KEV on a Friday (CVE-2024-8190) https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/09/13/cisa-adds-one-known-exploited-vulnerability-catalog
  • Microsoft updating Windows MSHTML Platform Spoofing Vulnerability CVE-2024-43461 to a publicly disclosed exploited zero-day on Friday evening https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-43461

#CVE_2024_8190 #CVE_2024_43461 #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #KEV #CISA #Microsoft #vulnerability #Ivanti

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-13T17:01:47.534Z ##

CISA releases an alert Ivanti Releases Security Update for Cloud Services Appliance, noting that CISA has added CVE-2024-8190 to its Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog.

#CVE_2024_8190 #Ivanti #vulnerability #activeexploitation #eitw #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #KEV #CISAKEV #cisa #IvantiCSA

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-13T16:28:59.356Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds One Known Exploited Vulnerability to Catalog
Hot off the press! CISA added CVE-2024-8190 to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog on a Friday, which is considered unusual.
CVE-2024-8190 (7.2 high, disclosed 10 September 2024 by Ivanti) Ivanti Cloud Services Appliance OS command injection vulnerability

cc: @ntkramer @hrbrmstr @goatyell @campuscodi

#CISA #KEV #KnownExploitedVulnerabilitiesCatalog #vulnerability #CVE #CVE_2024_8190 #ivanti #IvantiCSA

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-16T15:34:57.000Z ##

Horizon3: CVE-2024-8190: Investigating CISA KEV Ivanti Cloud Service Appliance Command Injection Vulnerability
See parent toots above for information and links to Ivanti's Cloud Services Appliance OS command injection vulnerability CVE-2024-8190, I'm too lazy to link them repeatedly.

@hacks_zach of Horizon3 takes a closer look at CVE-2024-8190, going from patch diffing to double-checking that this is an authenticated vulnerability. He writes "We theorize that most likely users who have been exploited have never logged in to the appliance, or due to lack of rate limiting may have had poor password hygiene and had weaker passwords."

See parent toots above for information and links to Ivanti's Cloud Services Appliance OS command injection vulnerability CVE-2024-8190, I'm too lazy to link them repeatedly.

@hacks_zach of Horizon3 takes a closer look at CVE-2024-8190, going from patch diffing to double-checking that this is an authenticated vulnerability. He writes "We theorize that most likely users who have been exploited have never logged in to the appliance, or due to lack of rate limiting may have had poor password hygiene and had weaker passwords."

#CVE_2024_8190 #Ivanti #vulnerability #IvantiCSA #eitw #activeexploitation #kev #CISA #knownexploitedvulnerabilitiescatalog #zeroday #CVE

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-14T13:37:04.000Z ##

  • Microsoft updating Windows MSHTML Platform Spoofing Vulnerability CVE-2024-43461 to a publicly disclosed exploited zero-day on Friday evening https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-43461

Hot off the press! CISA added CVE-2024-8190 to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities (KEV) Catalog on a Friday, which is considered unusual.
CVE-2024-8190 (7.2 high, disclosed 10 September 2024 by Ivanti) Ivanti Cloud Services Appliance OS command injection vulnerability

A critical security flaw in Ivanti CSA (CVE-2024-8190) is being actively exploited, posing a significant risk of full system compromise. With Ivanti CSA 4.6 reaching end-of-life, urgent action is needed to address this vulnerability. Stay informed and take necessary precautions.

Ivanti updated their Ivanti Cloud Services Appliance (CSA) security advisory with the following information:

CVE ID: CVE-2024-8190
Vendor: Ivanti
Product: Cloud Services Appliance
Date Added: 2024-09-13
Vulnerability: Ivanti Cloud Services Appliance OS Command Injection Vulnerability
Notes: https://forums.ivanti.com/s/article/Security-Advisory-Ivanti-Cloud-Service-Appliance-CSA-CVE-2024-8190; https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-8190

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-10T14:57:28.320Z ##

Ivanti security advisory: September 2024 Security Update
Happy #PatchTuesday from Ivanti. There are some serious vulnerabilities. I want to emphasize that Ivanti stated they "have no evidence of these vulnerabilities being exploited in the wild." See the following advisories:

  • Security Advisory EPM September 2024 for EPM 2024 and EPM 2022
  • Security Advisory Ivanti Cloud Service Appliance (CSA) (CVE-2024-8190)
  • Security Advisory Ivanti Workspace Control (IWC)

The big ones:

  • CVE-2024-29847 (perfect 10.0 critical 🥳 cc: @cR0w) deserialization in the agent portal of Ivanti EPM before 2022 SU6/September 2024 update allows unauth RCE
  • CVE-2024-32840, CVE-2024-32842, CVE-2024-32843, CVE-2024-32845, CVE-2024-32846, CVE-2024-32848, CVE-2024-34783, CVE-2024-34785: unspecified SQL injection in Ivanti EPM before 2022 SU6/September 2024 update allow remote authenticated attacker with admin privileges to RCE

#ivanti #vulnerability #cve #epm #iwc #csa

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-10T14:57:28.000Z ##

Ivanti security advisory: September 2024 Security Update
Happy #PatchTuesday from Ivanti. There are some serious vulnerabilities. I want to emphasize that Ivanti stated they "have no evidence of these vulnerabilities being exploited in the wild." See the following advisories:

  • Security Advisory EPM September 2024 for EPM 2024 and EPM 2022
  • Security Advisory Ivanti Cloud Service Appliance (CSA) (CVE-2024-8190)
  • Security Advisory Ivanti Workspace Control (IWC)

The big ones:

  • CVE-2024-29847 (perfect 10.0 critical 🥳 cc: @cR0w) deserialization in the agent portal of Ivanti EPM before 2022 SU6/September 2024 update allows unauth RCE
  • CVE-2024-32840, CVE-2024-32842, CVE-2024-32843, CVE-2024-32845, CVE-2024-32846, CVE-2024-32848, CVE-2024-34783, CVE-2024-34785: unspecified SQL injection in Ivanti EPM before 2022 SU6/September 2024 update allow remote authenticated attacker with admin privileges to RCE

updated 2024-09-14T15:37:37.257000

An issue has been discovered in GitLab EE affecting all versions starting from 16.11 prior to 17.1.7, from 17.2 prior to 17.2.5, and from 17.3 prior to 17.3.2. Due to incomplete input filtering, it was possible to inject commands into a connected Cube server.

  • CVE-2024-7890 (CVSSv4: 5.4 medium) LPE

CVE-2024-20503
(5.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-13T21:31:22

1 posts

A vulnerability in Cisco Duo Epic for Hyperdrive could allow an authenticated, local attacker to view sensitive information in cleartext on an affected system. This vulnerability is due to improper storage of an unencrypted registry key. A low-privileged attacker could exploit this vulnerability by viewing or querying the registry key on the affected system. A successful exploit could allow the a

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-04T16:48:01.000Z ##

Cisco security advisories includes a zero-day:

  • Cisco Meraki Systems Manager Agent for Windows Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20430 (7.3 medium) incorrect handling of directory search paths (CWE-427: Uncontrolled Search Path Element) to EoP
  • Cisco Smart Licensing Utility Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20439 (9.8 critical) Cisco Smart Licensing Utility Static Credential Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20440 (9.8 critical) Cisco Smart Licensing Utility Information Disclosure Vulnerability
  • Cisco Identity Services Engine Command Injection Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20469 (6.0 medium) insufficient validation of user-supplied input to authenticated command injection (the attacker must have valid Administrator privileges)
    • The Cisco PSIRT is aware that proof-of-concept exploit code is available for the vulnerability that is described in this advisory.
  • Cisco Expressway Edge Improper Authorization Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20497 (4.3 medium) inadequate authorization checks for Mobile and Remote Access (MRA) users could allow an attacker to intercept calls or make phone calls spoofing another phone number
  • Cisco Duo Epic for Hyperdrive Information Disclosure Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20503 (5.5 medium) improper storage of an unencrypted registry key could allow an authenticated, local attacker to view sensitive information in cleartext

EDIT: What @BleepingComputer took away out of this is that CVE-2024-20439 is a backdoor admin account: Cisco warns of backdoor admin account in Smart Licensing Utility

#zeroday #cisco #patchtuesday #vulnerability #CVE_2024_20469 #cve #CVE_2024_20439

(9.8 CRITICAL)

updated 2024-09-13T21:31:22

1 posts

A vulnerability in Cisco Smart Licensing Utility could allow an unauthenticated, remote attacker to log in to an affected system by using a static administrative credential. This vulnerability is due to an undocumented static user credential for an administrative account.   • Cisco Meraki Systems Manager Agent for Windows Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20430 (7.3 medium) incorrect handling of directory search paths (CWE-427: Uncontrolled Search Path Element) to EoP

    • CVE-2024-20440 (9.8 critical) Cisco Smart Licensing Utility Information Disclosure Vulnerability

    CVE-2024-20469 (6.0 medium) insufficient validation of user-supplied input to authenticated command injection (the attacker must have valid Administrator privileges)
    • The Cisco PSIRT is aware that proof-of-concept exploit code is available for the vulnerability that is described in this advisory.
  • Cisco Expressway Edge Improper Authorization Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20497 (4.3 medium) inadequate authorization checks for Mobile and Remote Access (MRA) users could allow an attacker to intercept calls or make phone calls spoofing another phone number
  • Cisco Duo Epic for Hyperdrive Information Disclosure Vulnerability

AAKL at 2024-09-13T16:04:08.581Z ##

#Microsoft has added four new Edge entries to its security updates guide.

- Chromium: CVE-2024-8639 Use after free in Autofill https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-8639

- Chromium: CVE-2024-8637 Use after free in Media Router https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-8637

- Chromium: CVE-2024-8638 Type Confusion in V8 https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-8638

- Chromium: CVE-2024-8636 Heap buffer overflow in Skia https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-8636

Microsoft's security updates grid: https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide #cybersecurity #infosec

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-13T02:13:12.700Z ##

I have to issue a correction: The Microsoft Edge team routinely patches against identified vulnerabilities and I mistakenly said that the 11 September 2024 security advisories were for Google Chrome's Tuesday blog post CVE IDs. Well those dropped today so let me identify which was for which:

  • CVE-2024-7970 and CVE-2024-8362 came from 02 September 2024 Google Chrome blog post.
  • CVE-2024-8194 and CVE-2024-8198 are from the 28 August 2024 Google Chrome blog post.
  • CVE-2024-38222 (6.5 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Information Disclosure Vulnerability was brand new.

So today's are for the 10 September 2024 Patch Tuesday Google Chrome blog post (see parent toot above):

  • CVE-2024-8639 Use after free in Autofill
  • CVE-2024-8638 Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-8637 Use after free in Media Router
  • CVE-2024-8636 Heap buffer overflow in Skia
##
AAKL@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-13T16:04:08.000Z ##

#Microsoft has added four new Edge entries to its security updates guide.

- Chromium: CVE-2024-8639 Use after free in Autofill https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-8639

- Chromium: CVE-2024-8637 Use after free in Media Router https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-8637

- Chromium: CVE-2024-8638 Type Confusion in V8 https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-8638

- Chromium: CVE-2024-8636 Heap buffer overflow in Skia https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-8636

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-13T02:13:12.000Z ##

I have to issue a correction: The Microsoft Edge team routinely patches against identified vulnerabilities and I mistakenly said that the 11 September 2024 security advisories were for Google Chrome's Tuesday blog post CVE IDs. Well those dropped today so let me identify which was for which:

  • CVE-2024-7970 and CVE-2024-8362 came from 02 September 2024 Google Chrome blog post.
  • CVE-2024-8194 and CVE-2024-8198 are from the 28 August 2024 Google Chrome blog post.
  • CVE-2024-38222 (6.5 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Information Disclosure Vulnerability was brand new.

So today's are for the 10 September 2024 Patch Tuesday Google Chrome blog post (see parent toot above):

  • CVE-2024-8639 Use after free in Autofill
  • CVE-2024-8638 Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-8637 Use after free in Media Router
  • CVE-2024-8636 Heap buffer overflow in Skia
##

CVE-2024-8636
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2024-09-13T15:31:32

4 posts

Heap buffer overflow in Skia in Google Chrome prior to 128.0.6613.137 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

AAKL at 2024-09-13T16:04:08.581Z ##

#Microsoft has added four new Edge entries to its security updates guide.

- Chromium: CVE-2024-8639 Use after free in Autofill https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-8639

- Chromium: CVE-2024-8637 Use after free in Media Router https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-8637

- Chromium: CVE-2024-8638 Type Confusion in V8 https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-8638

- Chromium: CVE-2024-8636 Heap buffer overflow in Skia https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-8636

Microsoft's security updates grid: https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide #cybersecurity #infosec

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-13T02:13:12.700Z ##

I have to issue a correction: The Microsoft Edge team routinely patches against identified vulnerabilities and I mistakenly said that the 11 September 2024 security advisories were for Google Chrome's Tuesday blog post CVE IDs. Well those dropped today so let me identify which was for which:

  • CVE-2024-7970 and CVE-2024-8362 came from 02 September 2024 Google Chrome blog post.
  • CVE-2024-8194 and CVE-2024-8198 are from the 28 August 2024 Google Chrome blog post.
  • CVE-2024-38222 (6.5 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Information Disclosure Vulnerability was brand new.

So today's are for the 10 September 2024 Patch Tuesday Google Chrome blog post (see parent toot above):

  • CVE-2024-8639 Use after free in Autofill
  • CVE-2024-8638 Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-8637 Use after free in Media Router
  • CVE-2024-8636 Heap buffer overflow in Skia
##
AAKL@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-13T16:04:08.000Z ##

#Microsoft has added four new Edge entries to its security updates guide.

- Chromium: CVE-2024-8639 Use after free in Autofill https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-8639

- Chromium: CVE-2024-8637 Use after free in Media Router https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-8637

- Chromium: CVE-2024-8638 Type Confusion in V8 https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-8638

- Chromium: CVE-2024-8636 Heap buffer overflow in Skia https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-8636

Microsoft's security updates grid: https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide #cybersecurity #infosec

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-13T02:13:12.000Z ##

I have to issue a correction: The Microsoft Edge team routinely patches against identified vulnerabilities and I mistakenly said that the 11 September 2024 security advisories were for Google Chrome's Tuesday blog post CVE IDs. Well those dropped today so let me identify which was for which:

  • CVE-2024-7970 and CVE-2024-8362 came from 02 September 2024 Google Chrome blog post.
  • CVE-2024-8194 and CVE-2024-8198 are from the 28 August 2024 Google Chrome blog post.
  • CVE-2024-38222 (6.5 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Information Disclosure Vulnerability was brand new.

So today's are for the 10 September 2024 Patch Tuesday Google Chrome blog post (see parent toot above):

  • CVE-2024-8639 Use after free in Autofill
  • CVE-2024-8638 Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-8637 Use after free in Media Router
  • CVE-2024-8636 Heap buffer overflow in Skia
##

CVE-2024-41869
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-09-13T14:06:04.777000

8 posts

Acrobat Reader versions 24.002.21005, 24.001.30159, 20.005.30655, 24.003.20054 and earlier are affected by a Use After Free vulnerability that could result in arbitrary code execution in the context of the current user. Exploitation of this issue requires user interaction in that a victim must open a malicious file.

screaminggoat at 2024-09-11T18:21:26.766Z ##

Bleeping Computer: Adobe fixes Acrobat Reader zero-day with public PoC exploit
References:

  • APSB24-70 Security update available for Adobe Acrobat and Reader (10 September 2024)
  • APSB24-57 Security update available for Adobe Acrobat and Reader (13 August 2024)

Okay I already have an EXPMON thread here (see parent toots above) so I'll orphan the original Adobe September 2024 Patch Tuesday toot. It should be noted that CVE-2024-41869 (7.8 high) UAF to arbitrary code execution in Adobe Acrobat and Reader is a Zero Day (Proof of Concept exploit in the wild exists before the vulnerability was patched, unknown if actually exploited). Apparently the August patch wasn't sufficient for the vulnerability CVE-2024-39383 (7.8 high, which should also be considered a zero-day). Haifei Li wrote on the Bad Place: "We tested the (exactly the same) sample on the "patched" Adobe Reader version, it displayed additional dialogs, but if the user clicked/closed those dialogs, the app still crashed! Same UAF bug!"

In yesterday's Adobe Reader security advisory, Adobe didn't call attention to the fact that a Proof of Concept exploit exists in the wild, or however they would normally word it.

#expmon #adobe #proofofconcept #zeroday #vulnerability #CVE_2024_41869 #CVE_2024_39383

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-11T18:21:26.000Z ##

  • APSB24-70 Security update available for Adobe Acrobat and Reader (10 September 2024)
  • APSB24-57 Security update available for Adobe Acrobat and Reader (13 August 2024)

It should be noted that CVE-2024-41869 (7.8 high) UAF to arbitrary code execution in Adobe Acrobat and Reader is a Zero Day (Proof of Concept exploit in the wild exists before the vulnerability was patched, unknown if actually exploited). Apparently the August patch wasn't sufficient for the vulnerability CVE-2024-39383 (7.8 high, which should also be considered a zero-day). Haifei Li wrote on the Bad Place: "We tested the (exactly the same) sample on the "patched" Adobe Reader version, it displayed additional dialogs, but if the user clicked/closed those dialogs, the app still crashed! Same UAF bug!"

In yesterday's Adobe Reader security advisory, Adobe didn't call attention to the fact that a Proof of Concept exploit exists in the wild, or however they would normally word it.

Bleeping Computer: Adobe fixes Acrobat Reader zero-day with public PoC exploit
References:

  • APSB24-70 Security update available for Adobe Acrobat and Reader (10 September 2024)
  • APSB24-57 Security update available for Adobe Acrobat and Reader (13 August 2024)

Okay I already have an EXPMON thread here (see parent toots above) so I'll orphan the original Adobe September 2024 Patch Tuesday toot. It should be noted that CVE-2024-41869 (7.8 high) UAF to arbitrary code execution in Adobe Acrobat and Reader is a Zero Day (Proof of Concept exploit in the wild exists before the vulnerability was patched, unknown if actually exploited). Apparently the August patch wasn't sufficient for the vulnerability CVE-2024-39383 (7.8 high, which should also be considered a zero-day). Haifei Li wrote on the Bad Place: "We tested the (exactly the same) sample on the "patched" Adobe Reader version, it displayed additional dialogs, but if the user clicked/closed those dialogs, the app still crashed! Same UAF bug!"

In yesterday's Adobe Reader security advisory, Adobe didn't call attention to the fact that a Proof of Concept exploit exists in the wild, or however they would normally word it.

CVE-2024-8656
(6.1 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-09-13T14:06:04.777000

2 posts

The WPFactory Helper plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Reflected Cross-Site Scripting due to the use of add_query_arg without appropriate escaping on the URL in all versions up to, and including, 1.7.0. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject arbitrary web scripts in pages that execute if they can successfully trick a user into performing an action such as clicking on a

AAKL at 2024-09-12T16:05:57.442Z ##

CVE-2024-41874
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.11%

updated 2024-09-13T12:30:46

2 posts

ColdFusion versions 2023.9, 2021.15 and earlier are affected by a Deserialization of Untrusted Data vulnerability that could result in arbitrary code execution in the context of the current user. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by providing crafted input to the application, which when deserialized, leads to execution of malicious code. Exploitation of this issue does not require user

screaminggoat at 2024-09-10T17:29:42.775Z ##

Adobe security advisories: Happy #PatchTuesday from Adobe:

  • APSB24-70 Security update available for Adobe Acrobat and Reader (2 new)
  • APSB24-71 Security updates available for Adobe ColdFusion (1 new)
    • noteworthy: CVE-2024-41874 (9.8 critical) Deserialization of untrusted data
  • APSB24-72 Security update available for Adobe Photoshop (5 new)
  • APSB24-66 Security Updates Available for Adobe Illustrator (6 new)
  • APSB24-58 Security Updates Available for Adobe Premiere Pro (2 new)
  • APSB24-55 Security Updates Available for Adobe After Effects (5 new)
  • APSB24-54 Security Updates Available for Adobe Audition (2 new)
  • APSB24-53 Security Updates Available for Adobe Media Encoder (5 new)

No mention of exploitation. h/t: @TheDustinChilds

##

CVE-2024-32840
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-09-13T00:31:50

2 posts

An unspecified SQL injection in Ivanti EPM before 2022 SU6, or the 2024 September update allows a remote authenticated attacker with admin privileges to achieve remote code execution.

screaminggoat at 2024-09-10T14:57:28.320Z ##

Ivanti security advisory: September 2024 Security Update
Happy #PatchTuesday from Ivanti. There are some serious vulnerabilities. I want to emphasize that Ivanti stated they "have no evidence of these vulnerabilities being exploited in the wild." See the following advisories:

  • Security Advisory EPM September 2024 for EPM 2024 and EPM 2022
  • Security Advisory Ivanti Cloud Service Appliance (CSA) (CVE-2024-8190)
  • Security Advisory Ivanti Workspace Control (IWC)

The big ones:

  • CVE-2024-29847 (perfect 10.0 critical 🥳 cc: @cR0w) deserialization in the agent portal of Ivanti EPM before 2022 SU6/September 2024 update allows unauth RCE
  • CVE-2024-32840, CVE-2024-32842, CVE-2024-32843, CVE-2024-32845, CVE-2024-32846, CVE-2024-32848, CVE-2024-34783, CVE-2024-34785: unspecified SQL injection in Ivanti EPM before 2022 SU6/September 2024 update allow remote authenticated attacker with admin privileges to RCE

#ivanti #vulnerability #cve #epm #iwc #csa

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-10T14:57:28.000Z ##

Ivanti security advisory: September 2024 Security Update
Happy #PatchTuesday from Ivanti. There are some serious vulnerabilities. I want to emphasize that Ivanti stated they "have no evidence of these vulnerabilities being exploited in the wild." See the following advisories:

  • Security Advisory EPM September 2024 for EPM 2024 and EPM 2022
  • Security Advisory Ivanti Cloud Service Appliance (CSA) (CVE-2024-8190)
  • Security Advisory Ivanti Workspace Control (IWC)

The big ones:

  • CVE-2024-29847 (perfect 10.0 critical 🥳 cc: @cR0w) deserialization in the agent portal of Ivanti EPM before 2022 SU6/September 2024 update allows unauth RCE
  • CVE-2024-32840, CVE-2024-32842, CVE-2024-32843, CVE-2024-32845, CVE-2024-32846, CVE-2024-32848, CVE-2024-34783, CVE-2024-34785: unspecified SQL injection in Ivanti EPM before 2022 SU6/September 2024 update allow remote authenticated attacker with admin privileges to RCE

  • Security Advisory EPM September 2024 for EPM 2024 and EPM 2022
  • Security Advisory Ivanti Cloud Service Appliance (CSA) (CVE-2024-8190)
  • Security Advisory Ivanti Workspace Control (IWC)

The big ones:

  • CVE-2024-29847 (perfect 10.0 critical 🥳 cc: @cR0w) deserialization in the agent portal of Ivanti EPM before 2022 SU6/September 2024 update allows unauth RCE
  • CVE-2024-32840, CVE-2024-32842, CVE-2024-32843, CVE-2024-32845, CVE-2024-32846, CVE-2024-32848, CVE-2024-34783, CVE-2024-34785: unspecified SQL injection in Ivanti EPM before 2022 SU6/September 2024 update allow remote authenticated attacker with admin privileges to RCE

#ivanti #vulnerability #cve #epm #iwc #csa

##

CVE-2024-34785
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-09-13T00:31:50

2 posts

An unspecified SQL injection in Ivanti EPM before 2022 SU6, or the 2024 September update allows a remote authenticated attacker with admin privileges to achieve remote code execution.

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-09-10T14:57:28.320Z ##

Ivanti security advisory: September 2024 Security Update
Happy #PatchTuesday from Ivanti. There are some serious vulnerabilities. I want to emphasize that Ivanti stated they "have no evidence of these vulnerabilities being exploited in the wild." See the following advisories:

  • Security Advisory EPM September 2024 for EPM 2024 and EPM 2022
  • Security Advisory Ivanti Cloud Service Appliance (CSA) (CVE-2024-8190)
  • Security Advisory Ivanti Workspace Control (IWC)

The big ones:

  • CVE-2024-29847 (perfect 10.0 critical 🥳 cc: @cR0w) deserialization in the agent portal of Ivanti EPM before 2022 SU6/September 2024 update allows unauth RCE
  • CVE-2024-32840, CVE-2024-32842, CVE-2024-32843, CVE-2024-32845, CVE-2024-32846, CVE-2024-32848, CVE-2024-34783, CVE-2024-34785: unspecified SQL injection in Ivanti EPM before 2022 SU6/September 2024 update allow remote authenticated attacker with admin privileges to RCE

#ivanti #vulnerability #cve #epm #iwc #csa

##

CVE-2024-29847
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.11%

updated 2024-09-12T22:35:00.440000

15 posts

Deserialization of untrusted data in the agent portal of Ivanti EPM before 2022 SU6, or the 2024 September update allows a remote unauthenticated attacker to achieve remote code execution.

1 repos

https://github.com/sinsinology/CVE-2024-29847

screaminggoat at 2024-09-13T14:55:45.578Z ##

Horizon3: CVE-2024-29847 Deep Dive: Ivanti Endpoint Manager AgentPortal Deserialization of Untrusted Data Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
Reference: CVE-2024-29847 (10.0 critical 🥳) Deserialization of untrusted data in Ivanti EPM = RCE (see parent toot above for security advisory)

Damn Horizon3, back at it again with the proof of concept and technical details for Ivanti Endpoint Manager (EPM) vulnerability CVE-20244-29847. While they state that this is a straightforward remote code execution, they have two caveats: while it technically involves deserialization, Horizon3 wants to describe it as command injection. There's also the vulnerability's interaction with the firewall.
Horizon3 at least demonstrates how to see if you're being exploited by CVE-2024-29847: "Any unexpected connections to the AgentPortal address in your environment should be investigated for malicious activity." cc: @cR0w

#CVE_2024_29847 #Ivanti #IvantiEPM #vulnerability #proofofconcept #vulnerabilityanalysis #infosec #cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-13T14:55:45.000Z ##

Horizon3: CVE-2024-29847 Deep Dive: Ivanti Endpoint Manager AgentPortal Deserialization of Untrusted Data Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
Reference: CVE-2024-29847 (10.0 critical 🥳) Deserialization of untrusted data in Ivanti EPM = RCE (see parent toot above for security advisory)

Damn Horizon3, back at it again with the proof of concept and technical details for Ivanti Endpoint Manager (EPM) vulnerability CVE-20244-29847. While they state that this is a straightforward remote code execution, they have two caveats: while it technically involves deserialization, Horizon3 wants to describe it as command injection. There's also the vulnerability's interaction with the firewall.
Horizon3 at least demonstrates how to see if you're being exploited by CVE-2024-29847: "Any unexpected connections to the AgentPortal address in your environment should be investigated for malicious activity." cc: @cR0w

##
patchnow24x7 at 2024-09-17T12:23:42.692Z ##

Update: Exploit code for CVE-2024-29847 is available now!!

Link: https://summoning.team/blog/ivanti-epm-cve-2024-29847-deserialization-rce/

IF YOU HAVEN'T PATCHED IT YET, PATCH IT NOW!!

#CyberSecurity #Ivanti #infosec

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-16T19:38:17.557Z ##

Following Summoning Team's accusation that Horizon3 published a vulnerability details and proof of concept for the wrong CVE, Horizon3 updated their blog post: CVE-2023-28324 Deep Dive: Ivanti Endpoint Manager AgentPortal Improper Input Validation

We initially wrote this post in reference to CVE-2024-29847, however this post actually describes CVE-2023-28324. We had incorrectly assumed that the SU5 update was comprehensive which resulted in us mistaking CVE-2023-28324 for CVE-2024-29847. The content of this blog has been updated accordingly.

h/t: @buherator cc: @cR0w

##
oversecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-09-16T19:20:32.000Z ##

Exploit code released for critical Ivanti RCE flaw, patch now

A proof-of-concept (PoC) exploit for CVE-2024-29847, a critical remote code execution (RCE) vulnerability in Ivanti Endpoint Manager, is now...

🔗️ [Bleepingcomputer] https://link.is.it/564e6i

##
Tinolle at 2024-09-13T18:17:03.193Z ##

CVE-2024-29847 Deep Dive: Ivanti Endpoint Manager AgentPortal Deserialization of Untrusted Data Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
https://www.horizon3.ai/attack-research/attack-blogs/cve-2024-29847-deep-dive-ivanti-endpoint-manager-agentportal-deserialization-of-untrusted-data-remote-code-execution-vulnerability/

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-13T15:04:13.573Z ##

@cR0w yeah I want to see all the relevant information at a glance:

  • CVE ID
  • CVSS score
  • disclosure date
  • if it's got a proof of concept
  • If it's exploited (on the KEV)
  • and the vendor/product
  • and the impact of the vulnerability
  • most importantly, with LINKS to back it up!!

which is why I try to include it all myself when I share vulnerabilities with others:

CVE-2024-29847 (10.0 critical, disclosed 10 September 2024 by Ivanti, has proof of concept) Ivanti EPM deserialization to RCE vulnerability.

The only issue is my own constant flip flopping of CVSS version numbers as vendors start adopting CVSSv4. Currently it's unusual, so everything I post is implied to be CVSSv3.1, and I explicitly write CVSSv4 when it's the only score available. But moving forward, I should include the version number for every CVSS score.

##
iulianvostrut@mastodon.social at 2024-09-11T06:44:49.000Z ##

URGENT: Ivanti released updates to address 10 critical vulnerabilities, including CVE-2024-29847 with a CVSS score of 10.0. Remote code execution possible. No exploits reported, but immediate updates are crucial. Don't delay! #cybersecurity #vulnerabilities

CVE-2024-6678
(9.9 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-12T21:34:55.633000

11 posts

An issue was discovered in GitLab CE/EE affecting all versions starting from 8.14 prior to 17.1.7, starting from 17.2 prior to 17.2.5, and starting from 17.3 prior to 17.3.2, which allows an attacker to trigger a pipeline as an arbitrary user under certain circumstances.

kristian@social.purrucker.de at 2024-09-12T14:43:21.000Z ##

Und wieder ein GitLab Critical Patch Release mit der CVE-2024-6678 und der Formulierung „strongly recommend“ und „upgraded to the latest version as soon as possible“. Schon der dritte in diesem Jahr, wenn ich mioch nicht verzählt habe. Sollte man wohl mal vor dem Wochenende einspielen …

#gitlab #update #patch #critical #CVE20246678

https://about.gitlab.com/releases/2024/09/11/patch-release-gitlab-17-3-2-released/

screaminggoat at 2024-09-12T15:30:23.400Z ##

17 vulnerabilities. The most critical vulnerability is CVE-2024-6678 (9.9 critical) Execute environment stop actions as the owner of the stop action job. See related Canadian Centre for Cyber Security (CCCS) security advisory

##

CVE-2024-20430
(7.3 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-12T21:32:06

1 posts

A vulnerability in Cisco Meraki Systems Manager (SM) Agent for Windows could allow an authenticated, local attacker to execute arbitrary code with elevated privileges.&nbsp; This vulnerability is due to incorrect handling of directory search paths at runtime. A low-privileged attacker could exploit this vulnerability by placing both malicious configuration files and malicious DLL files on an affe

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-04T16:48:01.000Z ##

Cisco security advisories includes a zero-day:

  • Cisco Meraki Systems Manager Agent for Windows Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20430 (7.3 medium) incorrect handling of directory search paths (CWE-427: Uncontrolled Search Path Element) to EoP
  • Cisco Smart Licensing Utility Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20439 (9.8 critical) Cisco Smart Licensing Utility Static Credential Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20440 (9.8 critical) Cisco Smart Licensing Utility Information Disclosure Vulnerability
  • Cisco Identity Services Engine Command Injection Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20469 (6.0 medium) insufficient validation of user-supplied input to authenticated command injection (the attacker must have valid Administrator privileges)
    • The Cisco PSIRT is aware that proof-of-concept exploit code is available for the vulnerability that is described in this advisory.
  • Cisco Expressway Edge Improper Authorization Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20497 (4.3 medium) inadequate authorization checks for Mobile and Remote Access (MRA) users could allow an attacker to intercept calls or make phone calls spoofing another phone number
  • Cisco Duo Epic for Hyperdrive Information Disclosure Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20503 (5.5 medium) improper storage of an unencrypted registry key could allow an authenticated, local attacker to view sensitive information in cleartext

EDIT: What @BleepingComputer took away out of this is that CVE-2024-20439 is a backdoor admin account: Cisco warns of backdoor admin account in Smart Licensing Utility

#zeroday #cisco #patchtuesday #vulnerability #CVE_2024_20469 #cve #CVE_2024_20439

##

CVE-2024-8637
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2024-09-12T15:34:09

4 posts

Use after free in Media Router in Google Chrome on Android prior to 128.0.6613.137 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

AAKL at 2024-09-13T16:04:08.581Z ##

#Microsoft has added four new Edge entries to its security updates guide.

- Chromium: CVE-2024-8639 Use after free in Autofill https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-8639

- Chromium: CVE-2024-8637 Use after free in Media Router https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-8637

- Chromium: CVE-2024-8638 Type Confusion in V8 https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-8638

- Chromium: CVE-2024-8636 Heap buffer overflow in Skia https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-8636

Microsoft's security updates grid: https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide #cybersecurity #infosec

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-13T02:13:12.700Z ##

I have to issue a correction: The Microsoft Edge team routinely patches against identified vulnerabilities and I mistakenly said that the 11 September 2024 security advisories were for Google Chrome's Tuesday blog post CVE IDs. Well those dropped today so let me identify which was for which:

  • CVE-2024-7970 and CVE-2024-8362 came from 02 September 2024 Google Chrome blog post.
  • CVE-2024-8194 and CVE-2024-8198 are from the 28 August 2024 Google Chrome blog post.
  • CVE-2024-38222 (6.5 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Information Disclosure Vulnerability was brand new.

So today's are for the 10 September 2024 Patch Tuesday Google Chrome blog post (see parent toot above):

  • CVE-2024-8639 Use after free in Autofill
  • CVE-2024-8638 Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-8637 Use after free in Media Router
  • CVE-2024-8636 Heap buffer overflow in Skia

CVE-2024-28991
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-09-12T15:33:09

9 posts

SolarWinds Access Rights Manager (ARM) was found to be susceptible to a remote code execution vulnerability. If exploited, this vulnerability would allow an authenticated user to abuse the service, resulting in remote code execution.

tarnkappeinfo@social.tchncs.de at 2024-09-17T05:51:03.000Z ##

📬 Sicherheitslücken in SolarWinds: Sofortiges Update empfohlen
#Datenschutz #ITSicherheit #CVE202428990 #CVE202428991 #Sicherheitslücke #SolarWinds #Update #ZDI https://sc.tarnkappe.info/f0780b

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-13T14:05:06.095Z ##

SolarWinds: SolarWinds Access Rights Manager (ARM) Deserialization of Untrusted Data Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (CVE-2024-28991)
CVE-2024-28991 (9.0 critical, disclosed 12 September 2024) SolarWinds Access Rights Manager (ARM) was found to be susceptible to a remote code execution vulnerability. If exploited, this vulnerability would allow an authenticated user to abuse the service, resulting in remote code execution.
Reported by Piotr Bazydlo (@chudypb) of Trend Micro Zero Day Initiative. No mention of exploitation.

EDIT: Piotr states that CVE-2024-28991 can be chained with CVE-2024-28990 (6.3 medium) SolarWinds Access Rights Manager (ARM) Hardcoded Credentials Authentication Bypass Vulnerability for pre-authenticated remote code execution.

#solarwinds #vulnerability #CVE_2024_28991 #cve

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-13T14:05:06.000Z ##

SolarWinds: SolarWinds Access Rights Manager (ARM) Deserialization of Untrusted Data Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (CVE-2024-28991)
CVE-2024-28991 (9.0 critical, disclosed 12 September 2024) SolarWinds Access Rights Manager (ARM) was found to be susceptible to a remote code execution vulnerability. If exploited, this vulnerability would allow an authenticated user to abuse the service, resulting in remote code execution.
Reported by Piotr Bazydlo (@chudypb) of Trend Micro Zero Day Initiative. No mention of exploitation.

EDIT: Piotr states that CVE-2024-28991 can be chained with CVE-2024-28990 (6.3 medium) SolarWinds Access Rights Manager (ARM) Hardcoded Credentials Authentication Bypass Vulnerability for pre-authenticated remote code execution.

#solarwinds #vulnerability #CVE_2024_28991 #cve

I have to issue a correction: The Microsoft Edge team routinely patches against identified vulnerabilities and I mistakenly said that the 11 September 2024 security advisories were for Google Chrome's Tuesday blog post CVE IDs. Well those dropped today so let me identify which was for which:

  • CVE-2024-7970 and CVE-2024-8362 came from 02 September 2024 Google Chrome blog post.
  • CVE-2024-8194 and CVE-2024-8198 are from the 28 August 2024 Google Chrome blog post.

CVE-2024-38217
(5.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.27%

updated 2024-09-12T01:00:01.133000

18 posts

Windows Mark of the Web Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability

richi@vmst.io at 2024-09-11T17:36:37.000Z ##

This month Redmond fixes 79 #security flaws in #Windows and other products

As regular as clockwork, it’s #PatchTuesday time again. What exciting treasures did #Microsoft bring us for #September? A good handful of bugs being exploited, including a CVSS  9.8 critical vuln.

The patch haul also includes #CVE202438217: A zero-day that scrotes have known about for SIX YEARS. In #SBBlogwatch, we set the Wayback Machine to Stun. At @TechstrongGroup⁠’s @SecurityBlvd: https://securityboulevard.com/2024/09/patch-tuesday-september-2024-richixbw/?utm_source=richisoc&utm_medium=social&utm_content=richisoc&utm_campaign=richisoc

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-10T18:04:38.395Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Four Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
CISA quick on the ball, adds Microsoft zero days to KEV:

  • CVE-2024-43491 (9.8 critical) Microsoft Windows Update Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38226 (7.3 high) Microsoft Publisher Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38217 (5.4 medium) Windows Mark of the Web Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38014 (7.8 high) Windows Installer Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

#Microsoft #cve #zeroday #vulnerability #eitw #cisa #kev #CVE_2024_43491 #CVE_2024_38226 #CVE_2024_38217 #CVE_2024_38014

jackc@kompost.cz at 2024-09-11T07:06:08.000Z ##

#kybez Microsoft Patch Tuesday:
- 79 oprav Windows, z toho 4 aktivně zneužívané, 7 kritických (z toho ale 3 v komponentách Azure a 2 v Sharepointu)
- zajímavá chyba obejití kontrol upravenými LNK soubory (CVE-2024-38217)
- v určitých verzích Windows je zranitelnost, kdy je možné provést downgrade komponent a tím i znovuobjevení starých již opravených zranitelností (CVE-2024-43491)

Celkově klidnější než obvykle.

screaminggoat at 2024-09-10T17:03:51.975Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Microsoft: 79 new CVEs, 4 NEW EXPLOITED ZERO DAYS:

  • CVE-2024-43491 (9.8 critical) Microsoft Windows Update Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (EXPLOITED)
  • CVE-2024-38226 (7.3 high) Microsoft Publisher Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability (EXPLOITED)
  • CVE-2024-38217 (5.4 medium) Windows Mark of the Web Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability (EXPLOITED and PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)
  • CVE-2024-38014 (7.8 high) Windows Installer Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (EXPLOITED)

EDIT: @BleepingComputer has mentioned that CVE-2024-38217 was marked publicly disclosed. Updated this to reflect it. See related reporting Microsoft September 2024 Patch Tuesday fixes 4 zero-days, 79 flaws

#CISA has added several #Microsoft vulnerabilities to the KEV lcatalogue.

- CVE-2024-38226: Microsoft Publisher Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-38226

- CVE-2024-43491: Microsoft Windows Update Remote Code Execution Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-43491

- CVE-2024-38014: Microsoft Windows Installer Privilege Escalation Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-38014

- CVE-2024-38217: Microsoft Windows Mark of the Web (MOTW) Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-38217 @cisacyber #cybersecurity #infosec

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-10T18:01:00.000Z ##

@TheDustinChilds Yeah that was my bad, CVE-2024-38217 was marked publicly disclosed.

##
cisakevtracker@mastodon.social at 2024-09-10T18:00:51.000Z ##

CVE ID: CVE-2024-38217
Vendor: Microsoft
Product: Windows
Date Added: 2024-09-10
Vulnerability: Microsoft Windows Mark of the Web (MOTW) Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
Notes: https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38217; https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-38217
CVE URL: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-38217

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-10T17:03:51.000Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Microsoft: 79 new CVEs, 4 NEW EXPLOITED ZERO DAYS:

  • CVE-2024-43491 (9.8 critical) Microsoft Windows Update Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (EXPLOITED)
  • CVE-2024-38226 (7.3 high) Microsoft Publisher Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability (EXPLOITED)
  • CVE-2024-38217 (5.4 medium) Windows Mark of the Web Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability (EXPLOITED and PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)
  • CVE-2024-38014 (7.8 high) Windows Installer Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (EXPLOITED)

EDIT: @BleepingComputer has mentioned that CVE-2024-38217 was marked publicly disclosed. Updated this to reflect it. See related reporting Microsoft September 2024 Patch Tuesday fixes 4 zero-days, 79 flaws

#microsoft #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #cve

##

CVE-2024-8687(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-11T18:31:19

2 posts

An information exposure vulnerability exists in Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software that enables a GlobalProtect end user to learn both the configured GlobalProtect uninstall password and the configured disable or disconnect passcode. After the password or passcode is known, end users can uninstall, disable, or disconnect GlobalProtect even if the GlobalProtect app configuration would not normally

screaminggoat at 2024-09-11T16:42:03.328Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday (on a Wednesday) from Palo Alto Networks as they put out 7 security advisories:

  • CVE-2024-8687 (CVSSv4: 6.9 medium) PAN-OS: Cleartext Exposure of GlobalProtect Portal Passcodes
  • CVE-2024-8690 (CVSSv4: 5.6 medium) Cortex XDR Agent: Local Windows Administrator Can Disable the Agent
  • CVE-2024-8689 (CVSSv4: 6.0 medium) ActiveMQ Content Pack: Cleartext Exposure of Credentials
  • CVE-2024-8691 (CVSSv4: 5.3 medium) PAN-OS: User Impersonation in GlobalProtect Portal
  • CVE-2024-8688 (CVSSv4: 6.7 medium) PAN-OS: Arbitrary File Read Vulnerability in the Command Line Interface (CLI)
  • CVE-2024-8686 (CVSSv4: 8.6 high) PAN-OS: Command Injection Vulnerability
  • PAN-SA-2024-0009 Prisma Access Browser: Monthly Vulnerability Updates
    • Note that they backport patches for presumably multiple known exploited Chromium vulnerabilities.

Palo Alto Networks is not aware of any malicious exploitation of this issue.

#pan #paloaltonetworks #vulnerability #cve

CVE-2024-8690(CVSS UNKNOWN)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-11T18:31:15

2 posts

A problem with a detection mechanism in the Palo Alto Networks Cortex XDR agent on Windows devices enables a user with Windows administrator privileges to disable the agent. This issue may be leveraged by malware to disable the Cortex XDR agent and then to perform malicious activity.

A vulnerability in the GlobalProtect portal in Palo Alto Networks PAN-OS software enables a malicious authenticated GlobalProtect user to impersonate another GlobalProtect user. (7.2 HIGH)

updated 2024-09-11T18:31:14

Multiple vulnerabilities in Cisco Routed PON Controller Software, which runs as a docker container on hardware that is supported by Cisco IOS XR Software, could allow an authenticated, remote attacker with Administrator-level privileges on the PON Manager or direct access to the PON Manager MongoDB instance to perform command injection attacks on the PON Controller container and execute arbitrary

screaminggoat at 2024-09-11T16:15:01.212Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday (on a Wednesday) from Cisco as they put out 8 security advisories:

  • Cisco IOS XR Software CLI Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20398 (8.8 high)
  • Cisco Routed Passive Optical Network Controller Vulnerabilities CVE-2024-20483 (7.2 high) and CVE-2024-20489 (8.4 high)
  • Cisco IOS XR Software CLI Arbitrary File Read Vulnerability CVE-2024-20343 (5.5 medium)
  • Multiple Cisco Products Web-Based Management Interface Privilege Escalation Vulnerability CVE-2024-20381 (8.8 high)
  • Cisco IOS XR Software Segment Routing for Intermediate System-to-Intermediate System Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20406 (7.4 high)
  • Cisco IOS XR Software Network Convergence System Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20317 (7.4 high)
  • Cisco IOS XR Software Dedicated XML Agent TCP Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20390 (5.3 medium)
  • Cisco IOS XR Software UDP Packet Memory Exhaustion Vulnerability CVE-2024-20304 (8.6 high)

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in this advisory.

(8.4 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-11T18:31:14

2 posts

A vulnerability in the storage method of the PON Controller configuration file could allow an authenticated, local attacker with low privileges to obtain the MongoDB credentials. This vulnerability is due to improper storage of the unencrypted database credentials on the device that is running Cisco IOS XR Software. An attacker could exploit this vulnerability by accessing the configuration files

  • Cisco IOS XR Software Segment Routing for Intermediate System-to-Intermediate System Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20406 (7.4 high)
  • Cisco IOS XR Software Network Convergence System Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20317 (7.4 high)
  • Cisco IOS XR Software Dedicated XML Agent TCP Denial of Service Vulnerability CVE-2024-20390 (5.3 medium)
  • Cisco IOS XR Software UDP Packet Memory Exhaustion Vulnerability CVE-2024-20304 (8.6 high)

The Cisco PSIRT is not aware of any public announcements or malicious use of the vulnerability that is described in this advisory.

#cisco #vulnerability #cve

##

CVE-2024-8096
(6.5 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-11T15:32:14

2 posts

When curl is told to use the Certificate Status Request TLS extension, often referred to as OCSP stapling, to verify that the server certificate is valid, it might fail to detect some OCSP problems and instead wrongly consider the response as fine. If the returned status reports another error than 'revoked' (like for example 'unauthorized') it is not treated as a bad certficate.

bagder@mastodon.social at 2024-09-11T05:49:13.000Z ##

#curl security advisory: CVE-2024-8096: OCSP stapling bypass with GnuTLS

https://curl.se/docs/CVE-2024-8096.html

##
bagder@mastodon.social at 2024-09-11T05:49:13.000Z ##

#curl security advisory: CVE-2024-8096: OCSP stapling bypass with GnuTLS

https://curl.se/docs/CVE-2024-8096.html

##

CVE-2024-43491
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 2.32%

updated 2024-09-10T18:30:54

22 posts

Microsoft is aware of a vulnerability in Servicing Stack that has rolled back the fixes for some vulnerabilities affecting Optional Components on Windows 10, version 1507 (initial version released July 2015). This means that an attacker could exploit these previously mitigated vulnerabilities on Windows 10, version 1507 (Windows 10 Enterprise 2015 LTSB and Windows 10 IoT Enterprise 2015 LTSB) syst

screaminggoat at 2024-09-11T20:05:46.486Z ##

@RecklessPush38671 @dangoodin @grey the inconsistency is CISA adding CVE-2024-43491 to the KEV Catalog when Microsoft explicitly states that "no exploitation of CVE-2024-43491 itself has been detected." cc: @todb

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-11T17:22:36.885Z ##

@grey For reference: https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-43491

My take on the situation is that Microsoft's "Exploitation Detected" means that exploitation happened as a result of the vulnerability which did roll back versions of Windows:

Starting with the Windows security update released March 12, 2024 - KB5035858 (OS Build 10240.20526), the build version numbers crossed into a range that triggered a code defect in the Windows 10 (version 1507) servicing stack that handles the applicability of Optional Components.

I think CISA added CVE-2024-43491 as a knee-jerk reaction on its face value of "exploited"

##
ChrisShort@hachyderm.io at 2024-09-11T10:00:44.000Z ##

CVE-2024-43491 - Security Update Guide - Microsoft - Microsoft Windows Update Remote Code Execution Vulnerability #SuggestedRead #devopsish https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-43491

##
jackc@kompost.cz at 2024-09-11T07:06:08.000Z ##

#kybez Microsoft Patch Tuesday:
- 79 oprav Windows, z toho 4 aktivně zneužívané, 7 kritických (z toho ale 3 v komponentách Azure a 2 v Sharepointu)
- zajímavá chyba obejití kontrol upravenými LNK soubory (CVE-2024-38217)
- v určitých verzích Windows je zranitelnost, kdy je možné provést downgrade komponent a tím i znovuobjevení starých již opravených zranitelností (CVE-2024-43491)

Celkově klidnější než obvykle.

September 2024 : Microsoft Patch Tuesday Summary.

Includes 4 ACTIVELY-EXPLOITED 0-day flaws.

Advisory Links:

CVE-2024-38226 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38226

CVE-2024-43491 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-43491

CVE-2024-38014 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38014

CVE-2024-38217 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38217

CVE-2024-38018 : https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/vulnerability/CVE-2024-38018

Release Note: https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/releaseNote/2024-Sep

##
PC_Fluesterer@social.tchncs.de at 2024-09-11T06:45:25.000Z ##

Microsoft Flickentag 2024-09

Im September 2024 bringt Microsoft (MS) Flicken für stattliche 79 Sicherheitslücken. Darunter sind 7, die MS selbst als kritisch einstuft. Von den Sicherheitslücken wurden und werden 4 bereits für Angriffe genutzt, eine davon schon seit 2018. Besonderes Augenmerk verdient CVE-2024-43491

https://www.pc-fluesterer.info/wordpress/2024/09/11/microsoft-flickentag-2024-09/

#Warnung #cloud #exploits #Microsoft #office #sicherheit #vorbeugen #WX #windows #wissen #zahlen

##
dangoodin at 2024-09-10T21:18:16.136Z ##

I'm having trouble parsing Microsoft's bulletin for CVE-2024-43491 (https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-43491). The bulletin has a "yes" under exploited. It also says: "Microsoft is aware of a vulnerability in Servicing Stack that has rolled back the fixes for some vulnerabilities." (Emphasis mine.) I interpret this as saying that yes, 43491 is under active exploit.

But later, the bulletin says: "This CVE documents the rollback of fixes that addressed vulnerabilities which affected some Optional Components for Windows 10 (version 1507). Some of these CVEs were known to be exploited, but no exploitation of CVE-2024-43491 itself has been detected."

So, is this an 0day or not?

##
AAKL at 2024-09-10T18:11:36.210Z ##

#CISA has added several #Microsoft vulnerabilities to the KEV lcatalogue.

- CVE-2024-38226: Microsoft Publisher Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-38226

- CVE-2024-43491: Microsoft Windows Update Remote Code Execution Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-43491

- CVE-2024-38014: Microsoft Windows Installer Privilege Escalation Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-38014

- CVE-2024-38217: Microsoft Windows Mark of the Web (MOTW) Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability https://www.cve.org/CVERecord?id=CVE-2024-38217 @cisacyber #cybersecurity #infosec

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-10T18:04:38.395Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Four Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
CISA quick on the ball, adds Microsoft zero days to KEV:

  • CVE-2024-43491 (9.8 critical) Microsoft Windows Update Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38226 (7.3 high) Microsoft Publisher Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38217 (5.4 medium) Windows Mark of the Web Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-38014 (7.8 high) Windows Installer Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability

#Microsoft #cve #zeroday #vulnerability #eitw #cisa #kev #CVE_2024_43491 #CVE_2024_38226 #CVE_2024_38217 #CVE_2024_38014

cisakevtracker@mastodon.social at 2024-09-10T18:01:22.000Z ##

CVE ID: CVE-2024-43491
Vendor: Microsoft
Product: Windows
Date Added: 2024-09-10
Vulnerability: Microsoft Windows Update Remote Code Execution Vulnerability
Notes: https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-43491; https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-43491

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-10T17:20:23.618Z ##

@mttaggart Yeah I'm reading it the same way. Also concerning: This CVE itself wasn't exploited but it is marked as such. Microsoft doesn't elaborate on which CVEs were exploited as a result of this:

This CVE documents the rollback of fixes that addressed vulnerabilities which affected some Optional Components for Windows 10 (version 1507). Some of these CVEs were known to be exploited, but no exploitation of CVE-2024-43491 itself has been detected.

sorry @cR0w. I was responding at the time and didn't include you.

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-10T17:03:51.975Z ##

Happy #PatchTuesday from Microsoft: 79 new CVEs, 4 NEW EXPLOITED ZERO DAYS:

  • CVE-2024-43491 (9.8 critical) Microsoft Windows Update Remote Code Execution Vulnerability (EXPLOITED)
  • CVE-2024-38226 (7.3 high) Microsoft Publisher Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability (EXPLOITED)
  • CVE-2024-38217 (5.4 medium) Windows Mark of the Web Security Feature Bypass Vulnerability (EXPLOITED and PUBLICLY DISCLOSED)
  • CVE-2024-38014 (7.8 high) Windows Installer Elevation of Privilege Vulnerability (EXPLOITED)

EDIT: @BleepingComputer has mentioned that CVE-2024-38217 was marked publicly disclosed. Updated this to reflect it. See related reporting Microsoft September 2024 Patch Tuesday fixes 4 zero-days, 79 flaws

#microsoft #vulnerability #zeroday #eitw #activeexploitation #cve

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-11T20:05:46.000Z ##

@RecklessPush38671 @dangoodin @grey the inconsistency is CISA adding CVE-2024-43491 to the KEV Catalog when Microsoft explicitly states that "no exploitation of CVE-2024-43491 itself has been detected." cc: @todb

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-11T17:22:36.000Z ##

@grey For reference: https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-43491

My take on the situation is that Microsoft's "Exploitation Detected" means that exploitation happened as a result of the vulnerability which did roll back versions of Windows:

Starting with the Windows security update released March 12, 2024 - KB5035858 (OS Build 10240.20526), the build version numbers crossed into a range that triggered a code defect in the Windows 10 (version 1507) servicing stack that handles the applicability of Optional Components.

I think CISA added CVE-2024-43491 as a knee-jerk reaction on its face value of "exploited"

##
ChrisShort@hachyderm.io at 2024-09-11T10:00:44.000Z ##

CVE-2024-43491 - Security Update Guide - Microsoft - Microsoft Windows Update Remote Code Execution Vulnerability #SuggestedRead #devopsish https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-43491

##
dangoodin@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-10T21:18:16.000Z ##

I'm having trouble parsing Microsoft's bulletin for CVE-2024-43491 (https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2024-43491). The bulletin has a "yes" under exploited. It also says: "Microsoft is aware of a vulnerability in Servicing Stack that has rolled back the fixes for some vulnerabilities." (Emphasis mine.) I interpret this as saying that yes, 43491 is under active exploit.

But later, the bulletin says: "This CVE documents the rollback of fixes that addressed vulnerabilities which affected some Optional Components for Windows 10 (version 1507). Some of these CVEs were known to be exploited, but no exploitation of CVE-2024-43491 itself has been detected."

So, is this an 0day or not?

##

##

CVE-2024-31490
(4.3 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-10T15:31:11

2 posts

An exposure of sensitive information to an unauthorized actor in Fortinet FortiSandbox version 4.4.0 through 4.4.4 and 4.2.0 through 4.2.6 and 4.0.0 through 4.0.5 and 3.2.2 through 3.2.4 and 3.1.5 allows attacker to information disclosure via HTTP get requests.

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-09-10T15:10:50.860Z ##

At least 10 Fortinet security advisories. Happy #PatchTuesday from Fortinet:

  • FG-IR-22-256 CVE-2024-36511 (CVSSv3.1: 3.7 low) Cookie security policy bypass
  • FG-IR-22-282 CVE-2024-31489 (CVSSv3.1: 6.8 medium) FortiClient - Lack of client-side certificate validation in ZTNA service
  • FG-IR-22-230 CVE-2022-45856 (CVSSv3.1: 4.8 medium) FortiClient(All) - Lack of client-side certificate validation using SAML SSO
  • FG-IR-23-204 CVE-2023-44254 (CVSSv3.1: 5.0 medium) IDOR on download logs feature
  • FG-IR-24-123 CVE-2024-33508 (CVSSv3.1: 7.3 high) Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in a Command in DAS component
  • FG-IR-24-048 CVE-2024-4863 (CVSSv3.1: 7.5 high) Inadequate user validation and no brute force protection on change password requests
  • FG-IR-23-362 CVE-2024-21753 (CVSSv3.1: 5.5 medium) Multiple path traversal in administrative interface
  • FG-IR-24-051 CVE-2024-31490 (CVSSv3.1: 4.3 medium) Sensitive files disclosure in diagnostic logs download
  • FG-IR-24-139 CVE-2024-35282 (CVSSv3.1: 4.2 medium) Unencrypted keychain permanent password
  • FG-IR-24-371 CVE-2024-45323 (CVSSv3.1: 4.3 medium) access to backend information and logs via RestAPI on shared environments

No mention of exploitation. Please note that Fortinet skews their displayed CVSS score (temporal) instead of showing base score, downplaying their severity. Read through these yourself to determine the best course of action

#fortinet #vulnerability #cve #fortios #forticlient

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-10T15:10:50.000Z ##

At least 10 Fortinet security advisories. Happy #PatchTuesday from Fortinet:

  • FG-IR-22-256 CVE-2024-36511 (CVSSv3.1: 3.7 low) Cookie security policy bypass
  • FG-IR-22-282 CVE-2024-31489 (CVSSv3.1: 6.8 medium) FortiClient - Lack of client-side certificate validation in ZTNA service
  • FG-IR-22-230 CVE-2022-45856 (CVSSv3.1: 4.8 medium) FortiClient(All) - Lack of client-side certificate validation using SAML SSO
  • FG-IR-23-204 CVE-2023-44254 (CVSSv3.1: 5.0 medium) IDOR on download logs feature
  • FG-IR-24-123 CVE-2024-33508 (CVSSv3.1: 7.3 high) Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in a Command in DAS component
  • FG-IR-24-048 CVE-2024-4863 (CVSSv3.1: 7.5 high) Inadequate user validation and no brute force protection on change password requests
  • FG-IR-23-362 CVE-2024-21753 (CVSSv3.1: 5.5 medium) Multiple path traversal in administrative interface
  • FG-IR-24-051 CVE-2024-31490 (CVSSv3.1: 4.3 medium) Sensitive files disclosure in diagnostic logs download
  • FG-IR-24-139 CVE-2024-35282 (CVSSv3.1: 4.2 medium) Unencrypted keychain permanent password
  • FG-IR-24-371 CVE-2024-45323 (CVSSv3.1: 4.3 medium) access to backend information and logs via RestAPI on shared environments

No mention of exploitation. Please note that Fortinet skews their displayed CVSS score (temporal) instead of showing base score, downplaying their severity. Read through these yourself to determine the best course of action

updated 2024-09-10T15:31:10

2 posts

An authorization bypass through user-controlled key [CWE-639] vulnerability in FortiAnalyzer version 7.4.1 and before 7.2.5 and FortiManager version 7.4.1 and before 7.2.5 may allow a remote attacker with low privileges to read sensitive data via a crafted HTTP request.

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-09-10T15:10:50.860Z ##

At least 10 Fortinet security advisories. Happy #PatchTuesday from Fortinet:

  • FG-IR-22-256 CVE-2024-36511 (CVSSv3.1: 3.7 low) Cookie security policy bypass
  • FG-IR-22-282 CVE-2024-31489 (CVSSv3.1: 6.8 medium) FortiClient - Lack of client-side certificate validation in ZTNA service
  • FG-IR-22-230 CVE-2022-45856 (CVSSv3.1: 4.8 medium) FortiClient(All) - Lack of client-side certificate validation using SAML SSO
  • FG-IR-23-204 CVE-2023-44254 (CVSSv3.1: 5.0 medium) IDOR on download logs feature
  • FG-IR-24-123 CVE-2024-33508 (CVSSv3.1: 7.3 high) Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in a Command in DAS component
  • FG-IR-24-048 CVE-2024-4863 (CVSSv3.1: 7.5 high) Inadequate user validation and no brute force protection on change password requests
  • FG-IR-23-362 CVE-2024-21753 (CVSSv3.1: 5.5 medium) Multiple path traversal in administrative interface
  • FG-IR-24-051 CVE-2024-31490 (CVSSv3.1: 4.3 medium) Sensitive files disclosure in diagnostic logs download
  • FG-IR-24-139 CVE-2024-35282 (CVSSv3.1: 4.2 medium) Unencrypted keychain permanent password
  • FG-IR-24-371 CVE-2024-45323 (CVSSv3.1: 4.3 medium) access to backend information and logs via RestAPI on shared environments

No mention of exploitation. Please note that Fortinet skews their displayed CVSS score (temporal) instead of showing base score, downplaying their severity. Read through these yourself to determine the best course of action
