Affected components do not properly validate the device tokens. This could allow an unauthenticated remote attacker to impersonate other devices onboarded to the system.

updated 2024-09-09T18:31:36

1 posts

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-05T14:07:10.000Z ##

Veeam Security Bulletin (September 2024). No mention of exploitation
Veeam Backup & Replication:

  • CVE-2024-40711 (9.8 critical) RCE
  • CVE-2024-40713 (8.8 high) MFA bypass
  • CVE-2024-40710 (8.8 high) RCE
  • CVE-2024-39718 (8.1 high) EoP file deletion
  • CVE-2024-40714 (8.3 high) TLS issue allows sensitive credentials interception
  • CVE-2024-40712 (7.8 high) path traversal (cc: @reverseics @cR0w) allows LPE

Veeam Agent for Linux: CVE-2024-40709 (7.8 high) LPE

Veeam ONE:

  • CVE-2024-42024 (9.1 critical) RCE
  • CVE-2024-42019 (9.0 critical) access the NTLM
  • CVE-2024-42023 (8.8 high) EoP code execution
  • CVE-2024-42021 (7.5 high) access saved credentials
  • CVE-2024-42022 (7.5 high) modify product config files
  • CVE-2024-42020 (7.3 high) HTML injection

Veeam Service Provider Console:

  • CVE-2024-38650 (9.9 critical) access the NTLM
  • CVE-2024-39714 (9.9 critical) arbitrary file upload/RCE
  • CVE-2024-39715 (8.5 high) RCE
  • CVE-2024-38651 (8.5 high) file overwrite/RCE

Veeam Backup for Nutanix AHV,Veeam Backup for Oracle Linux Virtualization Manager and Red Hat Virtualization: CVE-2024-40718 (8.8 high) LPE through SSRF

#veeam #vulnerability #cve

CVE-2016-3714
(8.4 HIGH)

EPSS: 97.36%

updated 2024-09-09T18:31:30

8 posts

The (1) EPHEMERAL, (2) HTTPS, (3) MVG, (4) MSL, (5) TEXT, (6) SHOW, (7) WIN, and (8) PLT coders in ImageMagick before 6.9.3-10 and 7.x before 7.0.1-1 allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via shell metacharacters in a crafted image, aka "ImageTragick."

##
cisakevtracker@mastodon.social at 2024-09-10T02:59:23.000Z ##

CVE ID: CVE-2016-3714
Vendor: ImageMagick
Product: ImageMagick
Date Added: 2024-09-09
Vulnerability: ImageMagick Improper Input Validation Vulnerability
Notes: This vulnerability affects a common open-source component, third-party library, or a protocol used by different products. For more information, please see: https://www.imagemagick.org/discourse-server/viewtopic.php?f=4&t=29588#p132726, https://imagemagick.org/archive/releases/; https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2016-3714
CVE URL: https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2016-3714

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-09T14:57:41.684Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press! EDIT: Page is now live. CISA added the following three vulnerabilities to the KEV Catalog:

  • CVE-2016-3714 (8.4 high) ImageMagick Improper Input Validation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2017-1000253 (7.8 high) Linux Kernel PIE Stack Buffer Corruption Vulnerability
    • Known To Be Used in Ransomware Campaigns? Known
  • CVE-2024-40766 (9.3 critical) SonicWall SonicOS Improper Access Control Vulnerability

Note: Arctic Wolf alleges CVE-2024-40766 exploitation in the wild by Akira ransomware affiliates: Arctic Wolf Observes Akira Ransomware Campaign Targeting SonicWall SSLVPN Accounts

cc: @neurovagrant @goatyell @ntkramer @hrbrmstr

##

CVE-2024-40711
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-09T18:30:30

7 posts

A deserialization of untrusted data vulnerability with a malicious payload can allow an unauthenticated remote code execution (RCE).

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-09-09T15:43:10.483Z ##

watchTowr: Veeam Backup & Response - RCE With Auth, But Mostly Without Auth (CVE-2024-40711)
Reference: CVE-2024-40711 (9.8 critical, disclosed 04 September 2024 by Veeam) Veeam Backup & Replication: A deserialization of untrusted data vulnerability with a malicious payload can allow an unauthenticated remote code execution (RCE). This vulnerability was reported by reported by Florian Hauser @frycos with CODE WHITE Gmbh @codewhitesec.

watchTowr doing what they do best, root cause analysis of vulnerabilities and breaking it down Barney style. Veeam Backup and Replication's CVE-2024-40711 has an authenticated RCE with a 9.8? watchTowr does patch-diffing (a lot of code and rambling). They name drop James Forshaw @tiraniddo in referencing “Stupid is as Stupid Does When It Comes to .NET Remoting”

Okay in reading through this, CVE-2024-40711 is actually comprised of two separate bugs. Veeam silently patched an improper authorization bug, then the deserialisation bug 3 months later. watchTowr claims that there is a way to bypass CVE-2024-40711 (details are still under embargo). They do not release a proof of concept due to the current situation and proclivity for ransomware actors to go after Veeam backups.

#cve_2024_40711 #vulnerability #rootcauseanalysis #cve #veeam #infosec #cybersecurity

##
benzogaga33@mamot.fr at 2024-09-06T09:40:03.000Z ##

Cette faille critique expose Veeam Backup & Replication à une exécution de code à distance https://www.it-connect.fr/faille-critique-veeam-backup-replication-cve-2024-40711/ #ActuCybersécurité #Vulnérabilités #Cybersécurité #Veeam

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-09T15:43:10.000Z ##

watchTowr: Veeam Backup & Response - RCE With Auth, But Mostly Without Auth (CVE-2024-40711)

This vulnerability was reported by reported by Florian Hauser @frycos with CODE WHITE Gmbh @codewhitesec.

watchTowr doing what they do best, root cause analysis of vulnerabilities and breaking it down Barney style. Veeam Security Bulletin (September 2024). No mention of exploitation
Veeam Backup & Replication:

  • CVE-2024-40711 (9.8 critical) RCE
  • CVE-2024-40713 (8.8 high) MFA bypass
  • CVE-2024-40710 (8.8 high) RCE
  • CVE-2024-39718 (8.1 high) EoP file deletion
  • CVE-2024-40714 (8.3 high) TLS issue allows sensitive credentials interception
  • CVE-2024-40712 (7.8 high) path traversal (cc: @reverseics @cR0w) allows LPE

Veeam Agent for Linux: CVE-2024-40709 (7.8 high) LPE

Veeam ONE:

  • CVE-2024-42024 (9.1 critical) RCE
  • CVE-2024-42019 (9.0 critical) access the NTLM
  • CVE-2024-42023 (8.8 high) EoP code execution
  • CVE-2024-42021 (7.5 high) access saved credentials
  • CVE-2024-42022 (7.5 high) modify product config files
  • CVE-2024-42020 (7.3 high) HTML injection

Veeam Service Provider Console:

  • CVE-2024-38650 (9.9 critical) access the NTLM
  • CVE-2024-39714 (9.9 critical) arbitrary file upload/RCE
  • CVE-2024-39715 (8.5 high) RCE
  • CVE-2024-38651 (8.5 high) file overwrite/RCE

Veeam Backup for Nutanix AHV,Veeam Backup for Oracle Linux Virtualization Manager and Red Hat Virtualization: CVE-2024-40718 (8.8 high) LPE through SSRF

#veeam #vulnerability #cve

CVE-2024-40710
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-09T18:30:30

1 posts

A series of related high-severity vulnerabilities, the most notable enabling remote code execution (RCE) as the service account and extraction of sensitive information (savedcredentials and passwords). Exploiting these vulnerabilities requires a user who has been assigned a low-privileged role within Veeam Backup & Replication.

  • CVE-2024-40711 (9.8 critical) RCE

  • CVE-2024-40712 (7.8 high) path traversal (cc: @reverseics @cR0w) allows LPE

##

CVE-2024-37288
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-09-09T09:30:53

2 posts

A deserialization issue in Kibana can lead to arbitrary code execution when Kibana attempts to parse a YAML document containing a crafted payload. This issue only affects users that use Elastic Security’s built-in AI tools https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/security/current/ai-for-security.html  and have configured an Amazon Bedrock connector https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/security/current/assista

screaminggoat at 2024-09-06T03:27:30.420Z ##

Elastic security advisory: Kibana 8.15.1 Security Update (ESA-2024-27, ESA-2024-28)

  • CVE-2024-37288 (CVSSv3.1: 9.9 critical) Kibana arbitrary code execution via YAML deserialization in Amazon Bedrock Connector
  • CVE-2024-37285 (CVSSv3.1: 9.1 critical) Kibana arbitrary code execution via YAML deserialization

No mention of exploitation. CVE-2024-37288 only affects users that use Elastic Security’s built-in AI tools 😂 and have configured an Amazon Bedrock connector.

#elastic #kibana #vulnerability #CVE

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-06T03:27:30.000Z ##

Veeam Security Bulletin (September 2024). No mention of exploitation
Veeam Backup & Replication:

  • CVE-2024-40711 (9.8 critical) RCE
  • CVE-2024-40713 (8.8 high) MFA bypass
  • CVE-2024-40710 (8.8 high) RCE
  • CVE-2024-39718 (8.1 high) EoP file deletion
  • CVE-2024-40714 (8.3 high) TLS issue allows sensitive credentials interception
  • CVE-2024-40712 (7.8 high) path traversal (cc: @reverseics @cR0w) allows LPE

Veeam Agent for Linux: CVE-2024-40709 (7.8 high) LPE

Veeam ONE:

  • CVE-2024-42024 (9.1 critical) RCE
  • CVE-2024-42019 (9.0 critical) access the NTLM
  • CVE-2024-42023 (8.8 high) EoP code execution
  • CVE-2024-42021 (7.5 high) access saved credentials
  • CVE-2024-42022 (7.5 high) modify product config files
  • CVE-2024-42020 (7.3 high) HTML injection

Veeam Service Provider Console:

  • CVE-2024-38650 (9.9 critical) access the NTLM
  • CVE-2024-39714 (9.9 critical) arbitrary file upload/RCE
  • CVE-2024-39715 (8.5 high) RCE
  • CVE-2024-38651 (8.5 high) file overwrite/RCE

Veeam Backup for Nutanix AHV,Veeam Backup for Oracle Linux Virtualization Manager and Red Hat Virtualization: CVE-2024-40718 (8.8 high) LPE through SSRF

#veeam #vulnerability #cve

CVE-2024-8385
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2024-09-06T18:32:29

2 posts

A difference in the handling of StructFields and ArrayTypes in WASM could be used to trigger an exploitable type confusion vulnerability. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 130 and Firefox ESR < 128.2.

screaminggoat at 2024-09-13T02:55:10.435Z ##

CISA: Vulnerability Summary for the Week of September 2, 2024
Sometimes I check the summary for hidden gems. This time, five of the Mozilla Firefox CVEs are CVSSv3.1: 9.8 critical

  • CVE-2024-8381 type confusion
  • CVE-2024-8384 memory corruption
  • CVE-2024-8385 type confusion
  • CVE-2024-8387 memory corruption
  • CVE-2024-8389 memory corruption

At a glance, they're obviously high severity. It's just that you won't have that sense of urgency at the time of announcement because you didn't see the CVSS score, or understand the impact.

Let's not forget to mention Hall of Shame Progress Software for having LoadMaster vulnerability CVE-2024-7591 with a perfect 10.0 🥳

CVE-2024-8387
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2024-09-06T18:32:29

2 posts

Memory safety bugs present in Firefox 129, Firefox ESR 128.1, and Thunderbird 128.1. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 130 and Firefox ESR < 128.2.

CVE-2024-8384
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.11%

updated 2024-09-06T18:32:29

2 posts

The JavaScript garbage collector could mis-color cross-compartment objects if OOM conditions were detected at the right point between two passes. This could have led to memory corruption. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 130, Firefox ESR < 128.2, and Firefox ESR < 115.15.

##

CVE-2024-40766
(9.3 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 1.02%

updated 2024-09-06T18:32:29

32 posts

An improper access control vulnerability has been identified in the SonicWall SonicOS management access, potentially leading to unauthorized resource access and in specific conditions, causing the firewall to crash. This issue affects SonicWall Firewall Gen 5 and Gen 6 devices, as well as Gen 7 devices running SonicOS 7.0.1-5035 and older versions.

oversecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-09-11T13:40:12.000Z ##

CISA Adds Three Critical Vulnerabilities to Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog

The Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) KEV Catalog adds CVE-2016-3714, CVE-2017-1000253, and CVE-2024-40766.

🔗️ [Cyble] https://link.is.it/2nxsl3

##
oversecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-09-10T15:10:05.000Z ##

CISA Adds Three Critical Vulnerabilities to Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog

The Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency (CISA) KEV Catalog adds CVE-2016-3714, CVE-2017-1000253, and CVE-2024-40766.

🔗️ [Cyble] https://link.is.it/pnbily

##
jbhall56 at 2024-09-10T11:47:51.379Z ##

Tracked as CVE-2024-40766, this improper access control flaw affects Gen 5, Gen 6, and Gen 7 firewalls. SonicWall patched it on August 22 and warned that it only impacted the firewalls' management access interface. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/critical-sonicwall-sslvpn-bug-exploited-in-ransomware-attacks/

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-10T06:39:59.185Z ##

@decio CISA confirmed active exploitation of CVE-2024-40766 by adding it to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog on Monday morning: https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/09/09/cisa-adds-three-known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog

This isn't just a spur of the moment addition either. CISA investigates and confirms exploitation before adding a CVE to the KEV.

##
decio at 2024-09-10T06:35:41.632Z ##

[related]
⚠️
La vulnerabilité du protocole SSLVPN de SonicWall est désormais exploitee dans les attaques par ransomware/exfiltration
👇
https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/critical-sonicwall-sslvpn-bug-exploited-in-ransomware-attacks/

Dans le cadre d'activités récentes observées par Arctic Wolf, les affiliés du ransomware Akira ont mené des attaques par ransomware avec un vecteur d'accès initial impliquant la compromission de comptes d'utilisateurs SSLVPN sur des appareils SonicWall.
👇
https://arcticwolf.com/resources/blog/arctic-wolf-observes-akira-ransomware-campaign-targeting-sonicwall-sslvpn-accounts/

"Au 9 septembre 2024, Rapid7 a connaissance de plusieurs incidents récents (à la fois externes et observés par Rapid7) dans lesquels des comptes SSLVPN SonicWall ont été ciblés ou compromis, y compris par des groupes de ransomware ; les preuves liant CVE-2024-40766 à ces incidents sont encore circonstancielles, mais compte tenu de l'intérêt des adversaires pour le logiciel en général, Rapid7 recommande fortement de remédier à la situation en urgence. Les vulnérabilités telles que CVE-2024-40766 sont fréquemment utilisées pour l'accès initial aux environnements des victimes."
👇
https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2024/09/09/etr-cve-2024-40766-critical-improper-access-control-vulnerability-affecting-sonicwall-devices/

[edit: ajout information]

L'ajout hier de cette vulnérabilité au Catalogue KEV (Known Exploited Vulnerabilities) par la CISA américaine vient confirmer son exploitation avérée par des groupes de cybercriminels comme point d’entrée.
👇
https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/09/09/cisa-adds-three-known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog

(Merci @screaminggoat pour l'avoir signalé)

[mesure de mitigation + mise à jour]
⬇️
"Pour minimiser l'impact potentiel, nous recommandons de limiter la gestion du pare-feu aux sources de confiance ou de désactiver la gestion du pare-feu WAN à partir de l'accès à l'internet. De même, pour SSLVPN, veuillez vous assurer que l'accès est limité aux sources de confiance, ou désactivez l'accès SSLVPN depuis l'internet."

"Appliquez le correctif dès que possible pour les produits concernés. Les dernières versions du correctif peuvent être téléchargées sur mysonicwall.com."
👇
https://psirt.global.sonicwall.com/vuln-detail/SNWLID-2024-0015

#CVE_2024_40766
#CyberVeille #SonicWall #ransomware

##
iulianvostrut@mastodon.social at 2024-09-10T03:50:01.000Z ##

Attention! Critical flaw in SonicWall devices being actively exploited by ransomware groups, including Akira. CVE-2024-40766 enables unauthorized access to SSLVPN user accounts. Take immediate action to secure your systems. Stay vigilant and update your security measures.

Notes: https://psirt.global.sonicwall.com/vuln-detail/SNWLID-2024-0015; https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-40766

##
catc0n at 2024-09-09T22:12:04.517Z ##

Double patch o'clock! One's rumored to be used by ransomware groups, and the other...probably *will* be used by ransomware groups one way or another 🤷‍♀️

Door #1: https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2024/09/09/etr-cve-2024-40766-critical-improper-access-control-vulnerability-affecting-sonicwall-devices/

Door #2: https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2024/09/09/etr-multiple-vulnerabilities-in-veeam-backup-and-replication/

Fun fact on door #2: Rapid7 IR has seen Veeam Backup & Replication exploited or accessed in some manner in more than 20% of incident responses YTD in 2024. (Our IR folks made sure to note this is mostly post-exploitation and not initial access.)

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-09T18:44:21.714Z ##

Rapid7: CVE-2024-40766: Critical Improper Access Control Vulnerability Affecting SonicWall Devices
See parent toot above for further information about CVE-2024-40766.

As of September 9, 2024, Rapid7 is aware of several recent incidents (both external and Rapid7-observed) in which SonicWall SSLVPN accounts were targeted or compromised, including by ransomware groups; evidence linking CVE-2024-40766 to these incidents is still circumstantial, but given adversary interest in the software in general, Rapid7 strongly recommends remediating on an emergency basis. Vulnerabilities like CVE-2024-40766 are frequently used for initial access to victim environments.

See related CISA alert: CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog

#cisa #kev #cve_2024_40766 #sonicwall #ransomware #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #SSLVPN #sonicos

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-09T14:57:41.684Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press! EDIT: Page is now live. CISA added the following three vulnerabilities to the KEV Catalog:

  • CVE-2016-3714 (8.4 high) ImageMagick Improper Input Validation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2017-1000253 (7.8 high) Linux Kernel PIE Stack Buffer Corruption Vulnerability
    • Known To Be Used in Ransomware Campaigns? Known
  • CVE-2024-40766 (9.3 critical) SonicWall SonicOS Improper Access Control Vulnerability

Note: Arctic Wolf alleges CVE-2024-40766 exploitation in the wild by Akira ransomware affiliates: Arctic Wolf Observes Akira Ransomware Campaign Targeting SonicWall SSLVPN Accounts

cc: @neurovagrant @goatyell @ntkramer @hrbrmstr

#kev #cisa #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #CVE_2024_40766 #CVE_2017_1000253 #CVE_2016_3714 #imagemagick #linux #sonicwall #sonicos #sslvpn #cisakev

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-09T12:38:27.898Z ##

Arctic Wolf: Arctic Wolf Observes Akira Ransomware Campaign Targeting SonicWall SSLVPN Accounts
Reference: CVE-2024-40766 (CVSSv3.1: 9.3 critical, disclosed 22 August 2024 by SonicWall, reported possible exploitation in the wild on 06 September 2024) SonicWall SSLVPN improper access control vulnerability.

Arctic Wolf implies that Akira ransomware affiliates exploited CVE-2024-40766. No indicators of compromise were provided. In carefully worded terms, they allude to Akira ransomware attacks with an initial access vector involving the compromise of SSLVPN user accounts on SonicWall devices.

In each instance, the compromised accounts were local to the devices themselves rather than being integrated with a centralized authentication solution such as Microsoft Active Directory. Additionally, MFA was disabled for all compromised accounts, and the SonicOS firmware on the affected devices were within the versions known to be vulnerable to CVE-2024-40766.

cc: @campuscodi @goatyell

#threatintel #CVE_2024_40766 #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #ransomware #infosec #cybersecurity #akira #sonicwall #sslvpn

##
jbhall56 at 2024-09-07T12:23:28.485Z ##

The vulnerability, tracked as CVE-2024-40766, carries a CVSS score of 9.3 out of a maximum of 10. https://thehackernews.com/2024/09/sonicwall-urges-users-to-patch-critical.html

benzogaga33@mamot.fr at 2024-09-07T09:40:02.000Z ##

flagthis@botsin.space at 2024-09-07T03:58:49.000Z ##

🚨 **Urgent Security Alert!** 🚨 A critical vulnerability (CVE-2024-40766) in SonicWall's SSL VPN allows hackers to take control of your devices. This high-severity flaw (CVSS score 9.3) is being exploited in the wild. Patch your SonicOS firewalls **immediately** to protect your network! #Cybersecurity #SonicWall #Vulnerability

https://www.flagthis.com/?pid=2701

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-06T17:19:01.588Z ##

SonicWall updated their security advisory for CVE-2024-40766 (CVSSv3.1: 9.3 critical) on 06 September 2024, stating "This vulnerability is potentially being exploited in the wild." (see parent toot above for the security advisory).
An interesting point is that they originally revised the CVSS score on 23 August 2024 from 8.6 to 9.3, and then added the recommendation "SonicWall strongly advises SSLVPN users with local accounts should change their passwords and enable MFA." on 28 August 2024.

See related Bleeping Computer reporting: SonicWall SSLVPN access control flaw is now exploited in attacks

#CVE_2024_40766 #sonicwall #vulnerability #CVE #eitw #activeexploitation

##
decio at 2024-09-06T15:13:18.676Z ##

Si vous administrez un de ces modèles, Il est essentiel de sécuriser ces systèmes rapidement pour éviter toute exploitation malveillante

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-10T06:39:59.000Z ##

@decio CISA confirmed active exploitation of CVE-2024-40766 by adding it to the Known Exploited Vulnerabilities Catalog on Monday morning: https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/09/09/cisa-adds-three-known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog

This isn't just a spur of the moment addition either. CISA investigates and confirms exploitation before adding a CVE to the KEV.

##
decio@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-10T06:35:41.000Z ##

[related]
⚠️
La vulnerabilité du protocole SSLVPN de SonicWall est désormais exploitee dans les attaques par ransomware/exfiltration
👇
https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/critical-sonicwall-sslvpn-bug-exploited-in-ransomware-attacks/

Dans le cadre d'activités récentes observées par Arctic Wolf, les affiliés du ransomware Akira ont mené des attaques par ransomware avec un vecteur d'accès initial impliquant la compromission de comptes d'utilisateurs SSLVPN sur des appareils SonicWall.
👇
https://arcticwolf.com/resources/blog/arctic-wolf-observes-akira-ransomware-campaign-targeting-sonicwall-sslvpn-accounts/

"Au 9 septembre 2024, Rapid7 a connaissance de plusieurs incidents récents (à la fois externes et observés par Rapid7) dans lesquels des comptes SSLVPN SonicWall ont été ciblés ou compromis, y compris par des groupes de ransomware ; les preuves liant CVE-2024-40766 à ces incidents sont encore circonstancielles, mais compte tenu de l'intérêt des adversaires pour le logiciel en général, Rapid7 recommande fortement de remédier à la situation en urgence. Les vulnérabilités telles que CVE-2024-40766 sont fréquemment utilisées pour l'accès initial aux environnements des victimes."
👇
https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2024/09/09/etr-cve-2024-40766-critical-improper-access-control-vulnerability-affecting-sonicwall-devices/

[edit: ajout information]

L'ajout hier de cette vulnérabilité au Catalogue KEV (Known Exploited Vulnerabilities) par la CISA américaine vient confirmer son exploitation avérée par des groupes de cybercriminels comme point d’entrée.
👇
https://www.cisa.gov/news-events/alerts/2024/09/09/cisa-adds-three-known-exploited-vulnerabilities-catalog

(Merci @screaminggoat pour l'avoir signalé)

[mesure de mitigation + mise à jour]
⬇️
"Pour minimiser l'impact potentiel, nous recommandons de limiter la gestion du pare-feu aux sources de confiance ou de désactiver la gestion du pare-feu WAN à partir de l'accès à l'internet. De même, pour SSLVPN, veuillez vous assurer que l'accès est limité aux sources de confiance, ou désactivez l'accès SSLVPN depuis l'internet."

"Appliquez le correctif dès que possible pour les produits concernés. Les dernières versions du correctif peuvent être téléchargées sur mysonicwall.com."
👇
https://psirt.global.sonicwall.com/vuln-detail/SNWLID-2024-0015

#CVE_2024_40766
#CyberVeille #SonicWall #ransomware

##
catc0n@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-09T22:12:04.000Z ##

Double patch o'clock! One's rumored to be used by ransomware groups, and the other...probably *will* be used by ransomware groups one way or another 🤷‍♀️

Door #1: https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2024/09/09/etr-cve-2024-40766-critical-improper-access-control-vulnerability-affecting-sonicwall-devices/

Door #2: https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2024/09/09/etr-multiple-vulnerabilities-in-veeam-backup-and-replication/

Fun fact on door #2: Rapid7 IR has seen Veeam Backup & Replication exploited or accessed in some manner in more than 20% of incident responses YTD in 2024. (Our IR folks made sure to note this is mostly post-exploitation and not initial access.)

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-09T18:44:21.000Z ##

Rapid7: CVE-2024-40766: Critical Improper Access Control Vulnerability Affecting SonicWall Devices
See parent toot above for further information about CVE-2024-40766.

As of September 9, 2024, Rapid7 is aware of several recent incidents (both external and Rapid7-observed) in which SonicWall SSLVPN accounts were targeted or compromised, including by ransomware groups; evidence linking CVE-2024-40766 to these incidents is still circumstantial, but given adversary interest in the software in general, Rapid7 strongly recommends remediating on an emergency basis. Vulnerabilities like CVE-2024-40766 are frequently used for initial access to victim environments.

See related CISA alert: CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog

#cisa #kev #cve_2024_40766 #sonicwall #ransomware #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #SSLVPN #sonicos

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-09T14:57:41.000Z ##

CISA: CISA Adds Three Known Exploited Vulnerabilities to Catalog
Hot off the press! EDIT: Page is now live. CISA added the following three vulnerabilities to the KEV Catalog:

  • CVE-2016-3714 (8.4 high) ImageMagick Improper Input Validation Vulnerability
  • CVE-2017-1000253 (7.8 high) Linux Kernel PIE Stack Buffer Corruption Vulnerability
    • Known To Be Used in Ransomware Campaigns? Known
  • CVE-2024-40766 (9.3 critical) SonicWall SonicOS Improper Access Control Vulnerability

Note: Arctic Wolf alleges CVE-2024-40766 exploitation in the wild by Akira ransomware affiliates: Arctic Wolf Observes Akira Ransomware Campaign Targeting SonicWall SSLVPN Accounts

cc: @neurovagrant @goatyell @ntkramer @hrbrmstr

#kev #cisa #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #CVE_2024_40766 #CVE_2017_1000253 #CVE_2016_3714 #imagemagick #linux #sonicwall #sonicos #sslvpn #cisakev

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-09T12:38:27.000Z ##

Arctic Wolf: Arctic Wolf Observes Akira Ransomware Campaign Targeting SonicWall SSLVPN Accounts
Reference: CVE-2024-40766 (CVSSv3.1: 9.3 critical, disclosed 22 August 2024 by SonicWall, reported possible exploitation in the wild on 06 September 2024) SonicWall SSLVPN improper access control vulnerability.

Arctic Wolf implies that Akira ransomware affiliates exploited CVE-2024-40766. No indicators of compromise were provided. In carefully worded terms, they allude to Akira ransomware attacks with an initial access vector involving the compromise of SSLVPN user accounts on SonicWall devices.

In each instance, the compromised accounts were local to the devices themselves rather than being integrated with a centralized authentication solution such as Microsoft Active Directory. Additionally, MFA was disabled for all compromised accounts, and the SonicOS firmware on the affected devices were within the versions known to be vulnerable to CVE-2024-40766.

cc: @campuscodi @goatyell

#threatintel #CVE_2024_40766 #vulnerability #eitw #activeexploitation #ransomware #infosec #cybersecurity #akira #sonicwall #sslvpn

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-06T17:19:01.000Z ##

SonicWall updated their security advisory for CVE-2024-40766 (CVSSv3.1: 9.3 critical) on 06 September 2024, stating "This vulnerability is potentially being exploited in the wild." (see parent toot above for the security advisory).
An interesting point is that they originally revised the CVSS score on 23 August 2024 from 8.6 to 9.3, and then added the recommendation "SonicWall strongly advises SSLVPN users with local accounts should change their passwords and enable MFA." on 28 August 2024.

See related Bleeping Computer reporting: SonicWall SSLVPN access control flaw is now exploited in attacks

#CVE_2024_40766 #sonicwall #vulnerability #CVE #eitw #activeexploitation

##

CVE-2024-40865
(0 None)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-06T12:08:04.550000

2 posts

The issue was addressed by suspending Persona when the virtual keyboard is active. This issue is fixed in visionOS 1.3. Inputs to the virtual keyboard may be inferred from Persona.

screaminggoat at 2024-09-13T15:28:26.590Z ##

Here's a fun one: GAZEploit attack
Reference: CVE-2024-40865 (score pending still, assigned 05 September 2024 by Apple) Inputs to the virtual keyboard may be inferred from Persona

Gazeploit is a novel attack that can infer eye-related biometrics from the avatar image to reconstruct text entered via gaze-controlled typing. Or as The Hacker News puts it: Apple Vision Pro Vulnerability Exposed Virtual Keyboard Inputs to Attackers

The GAZEploit attack leverages the vulnerability inherent in gaze-controlled text entry when users share a virtual avatar. Virtual avatars, whether shared through video calls, online meeting apps, live streaming platforms, or potentially malicious websites, pose a significant privacy risk by potentially exposing user information such as login credentials. By remotely capturing and analyzing the virtual avatar video, an attacker can reconstruct the typed keys. Notably, the GAZEploit attack is the first known attack in this domain that exploits leaked gaze information to remotely perform keystroke inference.

#CVE_2024_40865 #Apple #VisionPro #vulnerability #CVE #GAZEploit

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-13T15:28:26.000Z ##

Here's a fun one: GAZEploit attack
Reference: CVE-2024-40865 (score pending still, assigned 05 September 2024 by Apple) Inputs to the virtual keyboard may be inferred from Persona

Gazeploit is a novel attack that can infer eye-related biometrics from the avatar image to reconstruct text entered via gaze-controlled typing. Or as The Hacker News puts it: Apple Vision Pro Vulnerability Exposed Virtual Keyboard Inputs to Attackers

The GAZEploit attack leverages the vulnerability inherent in gaze-controlled text entry when users share a virtual avatar. Virtual avatars, whether shared through video calls, online meeting apps, live streaming platforms, or potentially malicious websites, pose a significant privacy risk by potentially exposing user information such as login credentials. By remotely capturing and analyzing the virtual avatar video, an attacker can reconstruct the typed keys. Notably, the GAZEploit attack is the first known attack in this domain that exploits leaked gaze information to remotely perform keystroke inference.

#CVE_2024_40865 #Apple #VisionPro #vulnerability #CVE #GAZEploit

CVE-2024-43102
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-09-05T21:23:40.503000

6 posts

Concurrent removals of certain anonymous shared memory mappings by using the UMTX_SHM_DESTROY sub-request of UMTX_OP_SHM can lead to decreasing the reference count of the object representing the mapping too many times, causing it to be freed too early. A malicious code exercizing the UMTX_SHM_DESTROY sub-request in parallel can panic the kernel or enable further Use-After-Free attacks, potentiall

CVE-2024-7591
(10.0 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-05T18:31:03

5 posts

Improper Input Validation vulnerability in Progress LoadMaster allows OS Command Injection.This issue affects: * LoadMaster: 7.2.40.0 and above * ECS: All versions * Multi-Tenancy: 7.1.35.4 and above

screaminggoat at 2024-09-13T02:55:10.435Z ##

CISA: Vulnerability Summary for the Week of September 2, 2024
Sometimes I check the summary for hidden gems. This time, five of the Mozilla Firefox CVEs are CVSSv3.1: 9.8 critical

  • CVE-2024-8381 type confusion
  • CVE-2024-8384 memory corruption
  • CVE-2024-8385 type confusion
  • CVE-2024-8387 memory corruption
  • CVE-2024-8389 memory corruption

At a glance, they're obviously high severity. It's just that you won't have that sense of urgency at the time of announcement because you didn't see the CVSS score, or understand the impact.

Let's not forget to mention Hall of Shame Progress Software for having LoadMaster vulnerability CVE-2024-7591 with a perfect 10.0 🥳

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-08T14:21:47.356Z ##

Progress Kemp security advisory: LoadMaster Security Vulnerability CVE-2024-7591
CVE-2024-7591 (perfect 10.0 🥳 cc: @cR0w, disclosed 04 September 2024) mproper Input Validation vulnerability in Progress LoadMaster allows OS Command Injection.This issue affects: * LoadMaster: 7.2.40.0 and above * ECS: All versions * Multi-Tenancy: 7.1.35.4 and above

We have not received any reports that this vulnerability has been exploited and we are not aware of any direct impact to customers.

hat tip to @BleepingComputer. See their related reporting: Progress LoadMaster vulnerable to 10/10 severity RCE flaw

CVE-2024-45195
(7.5 HIGH)

EPSS: 3.77%

updated 2024-09-05T18:30:56

14 posts

Direct Request ('Forced Browsing') vulnerability in Apache OFBiz. This issue affects Apache OFBiz: before 18.12.16. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 18.12.16, which fixes the issue.

Nuclei template

1 repos

#search_error

AAKL at 2024-09-10T15:51:31.715Z ##

Cyble: The Re-emergence of CVE-2024-32113: How CVE-2024-45195 has amplified Exploitation Risks https://cyble.com/blog/the-re-emergence-of-cve-2024-32113-how-cve-2024-45195-has-amplified-exploitation-risks/ @thecyberexpress #cybersecurity #infosec #Apache

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-10T15:16:22.115Z ##

Cyble: The Re-Emergence of CVE-2024-32113: How CVE-2024-45195 has amplified Exploitation Risks (emailwall)
Let me save you the click: the attacker IOC is 185[.]190[.]24[.]111. I don't get why they added a "give us your personal contact information for more technical details," this is a security worst practice.

Cyble reports exploitation attempts of CVE-2024-32113, and emphasized that the assigning of CVE-2024-45195 (which Rapid7 claims is a patch bypass for multiple CVEs with the same underlying issue which I believe is "permission check for ProgramExport and EntitySQLProcessor") resulted in more exploitation attempts.

References:

  • CVE-2024-32113 (9.1 critical, disclosed 09 May 2024, added to KEV Catalog 07 August 2024) Apache OFBiz Path Traversal Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-45195 (7.5 high, disclosed 04 September 2024 by Apache) Apache OFBiz remote code execution

#CVE_2024_32113 #CVE_2024_45195 #apache #ofbiz #vulnerability #cve

##
oversecurity@mastodon.social at 2024-09-10T13:50:10.000Z ##

The Re-Emergence of CVE-2024-32113: How CVE-2024-45195 has amplified Exploitation Risks

The Cyble Global Sensor Intelligence Network (CGSI) detected active exploitation attempts of the Apache OFBiz vulnerability CVE-2024-32113, leading...

🔗️ [Cyble] https://link.is.it/gu3nvt

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-06T18:10:15.059Z ##

Rapid7: CVE-2024-45195: Apache OFBiz Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution (Fixed)
Rapid7 provides vulnerability details for CVE-2024-45195 (7.5 high, disclosed 04 September 2024 by Apache) Apache OFBiz remote code execution. They claim that CVE-2024-32113, CVE-2024-36104, and CVE-2024-38856 are essentially the same vulnerability with the same root cause. CVE-2024-45195 is a patch bypass for all of those CVEs: “the underlying problem, the ability to fragment the controller-view map state, was not resolved” … “the ability to desynchronize the controller and view map state.” Rapid7 describes the exploitation process. The timeline shows the vulnerability disclosure process and confirmation of patch efficacy.
See related @BleepingComputer reporting: Apache fixes critical OFBiz remote code execution vulnerability

#apache #ofbiz #vulnerability #CVE_2024_45195 #CVE_2024_32113 #CVE_2024_36104 #CVE_2024_38856

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-09-06T10:30:02.000Z ##

Apache OFBiz team patches critical RCE vulnerability (CVE-2024-45195) https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/09/06/cve-2024-45195/ #webapplication #vulnerability #ApacheOFBiz #enterprise #opensource #Don'tmiss #Hotstuff #Rapid7 #News #CVE

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-09-06T10:30:02.000Z ##

Critical RCE Vulnerability Patched in Apache OFBiz (CVE-2024-45195) https://thecyberexpress.com/apache-ofbiz-rce-vulnerability-patched/ #enterpriseresourceplanning #TheCyberExpressNews #opensourcesoftware #VulnerabilityNews #CybersecurityNews #RCEvulnerability #Vulnerabilities #TheCyberExpress #FirewallDaily #securitypatch #Vulnerability #CVE202445195 #Cyberattack #cybercrime #databreach #exploit #hacking #Apache #OFBiz #Risk #ERP

CVE-2024-45195 :: Forced Browsing vulnerability in Apache OfBiz.. #PatchNOW

Note: This is a patch bypass for PREVIOUSLY EXPLOITED vulnerabilities like CVE-2024-32113, CVE-2024-36104 and CVE-2024-38856.

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-06T18:10:15.000Z ##

Rapid7: CVE-2024-45195: Apache OFBiz Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution (Fixed)
Rapid7 provides vulnerability details for CVE-2024-45195 (7.5 high, disclosed 04 September 2024 by Apache) Apache OFBiz remote code execution. They claim that CVE-2024-32113, CVE-2024-36104, and CVE-2024-38856 are essentially the same vulnerability with the same root cause. CVE-2024-45195 is a patch bypass for all of those CVEs: “the underlying problem, the ability to fragment the controller-view map state, was not resolved” … “the ability to desynchronize the controller and view map state.” Rapid7 describes the exploitation process. The timeline shows the vulnerability disclosure process and confirmation of patch efficacy.
See related @BleepingComputer reporting: Apache fixes critical OFBiz remote code execution vulnerability

#apache #ofbiz #vulnerability #CVE_2024_45195 #CVE_2024_32113 #CVE_2024_36104 #CVE_2024_38856

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-09-06T10:30:02.000Z ##

Apache OFBiz team patches critical RCE vulnerability (CVE-2024-45195) https://www.helpnetsecurity.com/2024/09/06/cve-2024-45195/ #webapplication #vulnerability #ApacheOFBiz #enterprise #opensource #Don'tmiss #Hotstuff #Rapid7 #News #CVE

##
jos1264@social.skynetcloud.site at 2024-09-06T10:30:02.000Z ##

CVE-2024-7012
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2024-09-04T18:32:00

1 posts

An authentication bypass vulnerability has been identified in Foreman when deployed with External Authentication, due to the puppet-foreman configuration. This issue arises from Apache's mod_proxy not properly unsetting headers because of restrictions on underscores in HTTP headers, allowing authentication through a malformed header. This flaw impacts all active Satellite deployments (6.13, 6.14 a

zhenech@chaos.social at 2024-09-06T16:58:45.000Z ##

One interesting observation about CVE-2024-7012 and CVE-2024-7923 (see https://theforeman.org/security.html): those should be absolutely trivial to scan for (REMOTE_USER is pretty much what every single default config uses), yet none of the 1000 "our security scanner found these vulnerabilities, fix ASAP!!!" reports we get from customers ever flagged that. But Apache MultiViews 🙄

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-04T16:48:01.000Z ##

Cisco security advisories includes a zero-day:

  • Cisco Meraki Systems Manager Agent for Windows Privilege Escalation Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20430 (7.3 medium) incorrect handling of directory search paths (CWE-427: Uncontrolled Search Path Element) to EoP
  • Cisco Smart Licensing Utility Vulnerabilities
    • CVE-2024-20439 (9.8 critical) Cisco Smart Licensing Utility Static Credential Vulnerability
    • CVE-2024-20440 (9.8 critical) Cisco Smart Licensing Utility Information Disclosure Vulnerability
  • Cisco Identity Services Engine Command Injection Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20469 (6.0 medium) insufficient validation of user-supplied input to authenticated command injection (the attacker must have valid Administrator privileges)
    • The Cisco PSIRT is aware that proof-of-concept exploit code is available for the vulnerability that is described in this advisory.
  • Cisco Expressway Edge Improper Authorization Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20497 (4.3 medium) inadequate authorization checks for Mobile and Remote Access (MRA) users could allow an attacker to intercept calls or make phone calls spoofing another phone number
  • Cisco Duo Epic for Hyperdrive Information Disclosure Vulnerability
    CVE-2024-20503 (5.5 medium) improper storage of an unencrypted registry key could allow an authenticated, local attacker to view sensitive information in cleartext

EDIT: What @BleepingComputer took away out of this is that CVE-2024-20439 is a backdoor admin account: Cisco warns of backdoor admin account in Smart Licensing Utility

#zeroday #cisco #patchtuesday #vulnerability #CVE_2024_20469 #cve #CVE_2024_20439

CVE-2024-8389
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-09-04T18:30:57

2 posts

Memory safety bugs present in Firefox 129. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and we presume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 130.

screaminggoat at 2024-09-13T02:55:10.435Z ##

CISA: Vulnerability Summary for the Week of September 2, 2024
Sometimes I check the summary for hidden gems. This time, five of the Mozilla Firefox CVEs are CVSSv3.1: 9.8 critical

  • CVE-2024-8381 type confusion
  • CVE-2024-8384 memory corruption
  • CVE-2024-8385 type confusion
  • CVE-2024-8387 memory corruption
  • CVE-2024-8389 memory corruption

At a glance, they're obviously high severity. It's just that you won't have that sense of urgency at the time of announcement because you didn't see the CVSS score, or understand the impact.

Let's not forget to mention Hall of Shame Progress Software for having LoadMaster vulnerability CVE-2024-7591 with a perfect 10.0 🥳

CVE-2024-6671
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.09%

updated 2024-09-04T15:53:07.733000

5 posts

In WhatsUp Gold versions released before 2024.0.0, if the application is configured with only a single user, a SQL Injection vulnerability allows an unauthenticated attacker to retrieve the users encrypted password.

screaminggoat at 2024-09-12T15:28:35.183Z ##

Trend Micro: Protecting Against RCE Attacks Abusing WhatsUp Gold Vulnerabilities
Trend Micro reports possible exploitation of CVE-2024-6670 and CVE-2024-6671 (both 9.8 critical, disclosed 16 August 2024 by Progress Software, has proofs of concept and technical vulnerability analysis from reporter) in WhatsUp Gold. Attacks began almost immediately upon release of the POC, and observed attacks abused NmPoller.exe to execute PowerShell scripts to download various remote access tools. Indicators of compromise provided.

#threatintel #whatsupgold #CVE_2024_6670 #CVE_2024_6671 #IOC #proofofconcept #POC #infosec #cybersecurity

CVE-2024-8362
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-09-04T14:35:16.777000

4 posts

Use after free in WebAudio in Google Chrome prior to 128.0.6613.119 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

screaminggoat at 2024-09-13T02:13:12.700Z ##

I have to issue a correction: The Microsoft Edge team routinely patches against identified vulnerabilities and I mistakenly said that the 11 September 2024 security advisories were for Google Chrome's Tuesday blog post CVE IDs. Well those dropped today so let me identify which was for which:

  • CVE-2024-7970 and CVE-2024-8362 came from 02 September 2024 Google Chrome blog post.
  • CVE-2024-8194 and CVE-2024-8198 are from the 28 August 2024 Google Chrome blog post.
  • CVE-2024-38222 (6.5 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Information Disclosure Vulnerability was brand new.

So today's are for the 10 September 2024 Patch Tuesday Google Chrome blog post (see parent toot above):

  • CVE-2024-8639 Use after free in Autofill
  • CVE-2024-8638 Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-8637 Use after free in Media Router
  • CVE-2024-8636 Heap buffer overflow in Skia
##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-12T12:02:07.444Z ##

  • https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-38222
  • https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-8362
  • https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-7970
  • https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-8194
  • https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-8198

2 posts

### Summary We discovered a DOM Clobbering vulnerability in Webpack’s `AutoPublicPathRuntimeModule`. The DOM Clobbering gadget in the module can lead to cross-site scripting (XSS) in web pages where scriptless attacker-controlled HTML elements (e.g., an `img` tag with an unsanitized `name` attribute) are present. We found the real-world exploitation of this gadget in the Canvas LMS which allows

avoidthehack@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-04T16:02:01.000Z ##

Zyxel warns of critical OS command injection flaw in routers

The OS command injection is tracked as CVE-2024-7261 and affects various Zyxel access point models and a #security router product.

Security routers are updated by cloud and patches are available for the affected access points. Update ASAP.

#cybersecurity #infosec #cve

https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/zyxel-warns-of-critical-os-command-injection-flaw-in-routers/

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-04T14:27:15.000Z ##

Zyxel security advisory for OS command injection vulnerability in APs and security router devices

CVE-2024-7261 (9.8 critical) improper neutralization in multiple Zyxel routers and access points allow for OS command injection. No mention of exploitation.
See related reporting from

  • Bleeping Computer: Zyxel warns of critical OS command injection flaw in routers
  • The Hacker News: Zyxel Patches Critical OS Command Injection Flaw in Access Points and Routers

#zyxel #vulnerability #CVE_2024_7261

##
jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-04T11:26:53.000Z ##

The flaw, tracked as CVE-2024-7261 and assigned a CVSS v3 score of 9.8 ("critical"), is an input validation fault caused by improper handling of user-supplied data, allowing remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands on the host operating system. https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/zyxel-warns-of-critical-os-command-injection-flaw-in-routers/

CVE-2024-8194
(8.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.06%

updated 2024-08-30T16:34:53.210000

4 posts

Type Confusion in V8 in Google Chrome prior to 128.0.6613.113 allowed a remote attacker to potentially exploit heap corruption via a crafted HTML page. (Chromium security severity: High)

screaminggoat at 2024-09-13T02:13:12.700Z ##

I have to issue a correction: The Microsoft Edge team routinely patches against identified vulnerabilities and I mistakenly said that the 11 September 2024 security advisories were for Google Chrome's Tuesday blog post CVE IDs. Well those dropped today so let me identify which was for which:

  • CVE-2024-7970 and CVE-2024-8362 came from 02 September 2024 Google Chrome blog post.
  • CVE-2024-8194 and CVE-2024-8198 are from the 28 August 2024 Google Chrome blog post.
  • CVE-2024-38222 (6.5 medium) Microsoft Edge (Chromium-based) Information Disclosure Vulnerability was brand new.

So today's are for the 10 September 2024 Patch Tuesday Google Chrome blog post (see parent toot above):

  • CVE-2024-8639 Use after free in Autofill
  • CVE-2024-8638 Type Confusion in V8
  • CVE-2024-8637 Use after free in Media Router
  • CVE-2024-8636 Heap buffer overflow in Skia
##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-12T12:02:07.444Z ##

@browserversiontracker @ruario was there no check for Microsoft Edge?
MSRC released a bunch of advisories last night:

  • https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-38222
  • https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-8362
  • https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-7970
  • https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-8194
  • https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/en-US/advisory/CVE-2024-8198

2 repos

https://github.com/0xb0mb3r/CVE-2024-5932-PoC

screaminggoat at 2024-09-12T16:27:09.926Z ##

SonicWall: Hold – Verify – Execute: Rise of Malicious POCs Targeting Security Researchers
cc: @wdormann @GossiTheDog @shellsharks based on a conversation we had last month: SonicWall warns that there's a growing trend of threat actors targeting security researchers with malicious proofs of concepts (they have a concept of a proof, also they're eating our dogs) for crypto mining, data exfiltration and backdoor installation. One particular vulnerability CVE-2024-5932 is a CVSS3.1 10.0 scoring WordPress code injection that's interesting enough to create fake PoCs for. SonicWall provides indicators in case you accidentally executed the malicious script.

#threatintel #proofofconcept #ioc #securityresearch #vulnerabilityresearch #CVE_2024_5932 #infosec #cybersecurity

##

CVE-2024-39383
(7.8 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.07%

updated 2024-08-20T19:26:34.947000

4 posts

Acrobat Reader versions 20.005.30636, 24.002.20965, 24.002.20964, 24.001.30123 and earlier are affected by a Use After Free vulnerability that could result in arbitrary code execution in the context of the current user. Exploitation of this issue requires user interaction in that a victim must open a malicious file.

screaminggoat at 2024-09-11T18:21:26.766Z ##

Bleeping Computer: Adobe fixes Acrobat Reader zero-day with public PoC exploit
References:

  • APSB24-70 Security update available for Adobe Acrobat and Reader (10 September 2024)
  • APSB24-57 Security update available for Adobe Acrobat and Reader (13 August 2024)

Okay I already have an EXPMON thread here (see parent toots above) so I'll orphan the original Adobe September 2024 Patch Tuesday toot. It should be noted that CVE-2024-41869 (7.8 high) UAF to arbitrary code execution in Adobe Acrobat and Reader is a Zero Day (Proof of Concept exploit in the wild exists before the vulnerability was patched, unknown if actually exploited). Apparently the August patch wasn't sufficient for the vulnerability CVE-2024-39383 (7.8 high, which should also be considered a zero-day). Haifei Li wrote on the Bad Place: "We tested the (exactly the same) sample on the "patched" Adobe Reader version, it displayed additional dialogs, but if the user clicked/closed those dialogs, the app still crashed! Same UAF bug!"

In yesterday's Adobe Reader security advisory, Adobe didn't call attention to the fact that a Proof of Concept exploit exists in the wild, or however they would normally word it.

#expmon #adobe #proofofconcept #zeroday #vulnerability #CVE_2024_41869 #CVE_2024_39383

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-11T18:21:26.000Z ##

Bleeping Computer: Adobe fixes Acrobat Reader zero-day with public PoC exploit
References:

  • APSB24-70 Security update available for Adobe Acrobat and Reader (10 September 2024)
  • APSB24-57 Security update available for Adobe Acrobat and Reader (13 August 2024)

Okay I already have an EXPMON thread here (see parent toots above) so I'll orphan the original Adobe September 2024 Patch Tuesday toot. It should be noted that CVE-2024-41869 (7.8 high) UAF to arbitrary code execution in Adobe Acrobat and Reader is a Zero Day (Proof of Concept exploit in the wild exists before the vulnerability was patched, unknown if actually exploited). Apparently the August patch wasn't sufficient for the vulnerability CVE-2024-39383 (7.8 high, which should also be considered a zero-day). Haifei Li wrote on the Bad Place: "We tested the (exactly the same) sample on the "patched" Adobe Reader version, it displayed additional dialogs, but if the user clicked/closed those dialogs, the app still crashed! Same UAF bug!"

In yesterday's Adobe Reader security advisory, Adobe didn't call attention to the fact that a Proof of Concept exploit exists in the wild, or however they would normally word it.

#expmon #adobe #proofofconcept #zeroday #vulnerability #CVE_2024_41869 #CVE_2024_39383

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-11T18:21:26.766Z ##

  • APSB24-57 Security update available for Adobe Acrobat and Reader (13 August 2024)

CVE-2024-23897
(9.8 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 97.03%

updated 2024-08-20T18:00:43

2 posts

Jenkins has a built-in command line interface (CLI) to access Jenkins from a script or shell environment. Jenkins uses the args4j library to parse command arguments and options on the Jenkins controller when processing CLI commands. This command parser has a feature that replaces an @ character followed by a file path in an argument with the file’s contents (expandAtFiles). This feature is enable

Nuclei template

1 repos

#search_error

screaminggoat at 2024-09-10T03:13:39.721Z ##

ASEC: Jenkins Servers in Korea With Exposed Vulnerabilities (CVE-2024-23897, CVE-2024-43044)
AhnLab SEcurity intelligence Center (ASEC) highlights the many thousands of internet-exposed Jenkins servers in Korea with identifiable version information, of which 2,824 are vulnerable to CVE-2024-23897 and 3,969 are vulnerable to CVE-2024-43044. They note that both vulnerabilities have publicly available Proofs of Concept (PoC) codes, and that CVE-2024-23897 is reportedly exploited in the wild (linking to CISA's KEV Catalog).

#Jenkins #Cve_2024_23897 #CVE_2024_43044 #vulnerability #CVE #eitw

They note that both vulnerabilities have publicly available Proofs of Concept (PoC) codes, and that CVE-2024-23897 is reportedly exploited in the wild (linking to CISA's KEV Catalog).

CVE-2024-43044
(9.1 CRITICAL)

EPSS: 0.05%

updated 2024-08-16T18:33:08

2 posts

Jenkins uses the Remoting library (typically `agent.jar` or `remoting.jar`) for the communication between controller and agents. This library allows agents to load classes and classloader resources from the controller, so that Java objects sent from the controller (build steps, etc.) can be executed on agents. In addition to individual class and resource files, Remoting also allows Jenkins plugin

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-04T18:11:48.000Z ##

@happygeek it's a bit late to include this information since you already published it but GrapheneOS Foundation, a Canadian non-profit (privacy-enhanced and security-focused Android distribution) confirmed that CVE-2024-32896 “is the 2nd part of the fix for CVE-2024-29748 vulnerability” which are being actively exploited in the wild by forensic companies. Additionally GrapheneOS notes that “none of this is actually Pixel specific.”

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-03T18:38:08.000Z ##

Android security advisory: Android Security Bulletin—September 2024
Don't shit your pants like I did when I saw "Note: There are indications that CVE-2024-32896 may be under limited, targeted exploitation." and thought A GODDAMN ZERO-DAY. Well yes, but actually no: CVE-2024-32896 (7.8 high) Android Pixel Privilege Escalation Vulnerability was disclosed back on 11 June 2024. This apparently is a backporting of that patch to the rest of Android.
Don't forget to check out the following updated security bulletins:

  • Pixel Update Bulletin—September 2024
  • Android Automotive OS Update Bulletin—September 2024
  • Wear OS Security Bulletin—September 2024
  • No Pixel Watch (at this time)

No mention of exploitation (of anything new)

#PatchTuesday #Android #vulnerability #CVE

@happygeek it's a bit late to include this information since you already published it but GrapheneOS Foundation, a Canadian non-profit (privacy-enhanced and security-focused Android distribution) confirmed that CVE-2024-32896 “is the 2nd part of the fix for CVE-2024-29748 vulnerability” which are being actively exploited in the wild by forensic companies. Incorrect behavior order in transition between executive monitor and SMI transfer monitor (STM) in some Intel(R) Processor may allow a privileged user to potentially enable escalation of privilege via local access.

Larvitz@burningboard.net at 2024-09-15T10:53:52.000Z ##

Wow. My 6 year old Lenovo ThinkPad T480 got a new Firmware upgrade 1.52 today via fwupd. They actually published a new update after all that time 😯 Just a "fwupdmgr update" in Linux was enough to upgrade it.

Version 1.52 (UEFI BIOS)
[Important updates]
- Enhancement to address security vulnerability,CVE-2024-29979, CVE-2024-29980.
- Enhancement to address security vulnerability,CVE-2024-24853.
- Enhancement to address security vulnerability,CVE-2023-45236, CVE-2023-45237.

[New functions or enhancements]
- Updated the Diagnostics module to version 04.35.000.
- Updated the CPU microcode.

#thinkpad #t480 #fwupd #linux

habr@zhub.link at 2024-09-17T11:52:15.000Z ##

Волк в овечьей шкуре — как атакующие эксплуатируют CVE-2023-38831 в WinRAR

Привет, Хабр! Меня зовут Илья Ефимов, я аналитик-исследователь угроз кибербезопасности в компании R-Vision. Моя статья будет посвящена разбору уязвимости CVE-2023-38831 в архиваторе WinRAR . Эта уязвимость активно используется хакерами в атаках на отечественные компании. В отчете компании BI.ZONE фиксируется информация, что злоумышленники из групп Cobalt Werewolf, Mysterious Werewolf использовали данную уязвимость для доставки вредоносной полезной нагрузки. В этом случае уязвимость эксплуатировала вредоносный архив при доставке фишингового письма. Схожую информацию предоставляют исследователи из Positive Technologies , связав активность группировки ExCobalt с эксплуатацией CVE-2023-38831. Также фиксировались случаи эксплуатации данной уязвимости ВПО Agent Tesla и DarkMe . Стоит отметить, что по данным компании Kaspersky в 2024 году данная уязвимость занимает третье место по частоте эксплуатации атакующими в России и странах СНГ. В своей статье я опишу, в чем заключается суть уязвимости, продемонстрирую её эксплуатацию, а также генерируемые события по активности. Затем я подробно опишу процесс детектирования уязвимости и определю основные артефакты с помощью R-Vision SIEM. Смотреть

https://habr.com/ru/companies/rvision/articles/837632/

#winrar #cve202338831 #уязвимости #siem #correlation_rule #winapi #windbg

Improper Limitation of a Pathname to a Restricted Directory ('Path Traversal') vulnerability in Apache OFBiz.This issue affects Apache OFBiz: before 18.12.13. Users are recommended to upgrade to version 18.12.13, which fixes the issue.

habr@zhub.link at 2024-09-16T13:32:14.000Z ##

Apache OFBiz CVE-2024-32113

Ранее в наших статьях мы уже упоминали Вам об уязвимостях CVE-2023-49070 и CVE-2023-51467 в Apache OFBiz , не прошло и пол года, как 05 августа 2024 была опубликована новая уязвимость с неправильным ограничением пути к закрытому каталогу CVE-2024-32113 (CVSS 3.x 9.8 баллов), затрагивающая версии ниже 18.12.14 . Для тех, кто мало знаком с данным решением, давайте еще раз узнаем, что это за продукт. Apache OFBiz - это open-source программное обеспечение, включающее в себя множество различных приложений для интеграции и автоматизации множества бизнес-процессов предприятий. В этой статье мы развернем уязвимую версию OFBiz и разберемся как эксплуатировать ее.

https://habr.com/ru/articles/843750/

#Apache_OFBiz #CVE202432113 #rce #path_traversal

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-10T15:16:22.115Z ##

Cyble: The Re-Emergence of CVE-2024-32113: How CVE-2024-45195 has amplified Exploitation Risks (emailwall)
Let me save you the click: the attacker IOC is 185[.]190[.]24[.]111. I don't get why they added a "give us your personal contact information for more technical details," this is a security worst practice.

Cyble reports exploitation attempts of CVE-2024-32113, and emphasized that the assigning of CVE-2024-45195 (which Rapid7 claims is a patch bypass for multiple CVEs with the same underlying issue which I believe is "permission check for ProgramExport and EntitySQLProcessor") resulted in more exploitation attempts.

References:

  • CVE-2024-32113 (9.1 critical, disclosed 09 May 2024, added to KEV Catalog 07 August 2024) Apache OFBiz Path Traversal Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-45195 (7.5 high, disclosed 04 September 2024 by Apache) Apache OFBiz remote code execution

#CVE_2024_32113 #CVE_2024_45195 #apache #ofbiz #vulnerability #cve

##
screaminggoat at 2024-09-06T18:10:15.059Z ##

Rapid7: CVE-2024-45195: Apache OFBiz Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution (Fixed)
Rapid7 provides vulnerability details for CVE-2024-45195 (7.5 high, disclosed 04 September 2024 by Apache) Apache OFBiz remote code execution. They claim that CVE-2024-32113, CVE-2024-36104, and CVE-2024-38856 are essentially the same vulnerability with the same root cause. CVE-2024-45195 is a patch bypass for all of those CVEs: “the underlying problem, the ability to fragment the controller-view map state, was not resolved” … “the ability to desynchronize the controller and view map state.” Rapid7 describes the exploitation process. The timeline shows the vulnerability disclosure process and confirmation of patch efficacy.
See related @BleepingComputer reporting: Apache fixes critical OFBiz remote code execution vulnerability

#apache #ofbiz #vulnerability #CVE_2024_45195 #CVE_2024_32113 #CVE_2024_36104 #CVE_2024_38856

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-10T15:16:22.000Z ##

Cyble: The Re-Emergence of CVE-2024-32113: How CVE-2024-45195 has amplified Exploitation Risks (emailwall)
Let me save you the click: the attacker IOC is 185[.]190[.]24[.]111. I don't get why they added a "give us your personal contact information for more technical details," this is a security worst practice.

Cyble reports exploitation attempts of CVE-2024-32113, and emphasized that the assigning of CVE-2024-45195 (which Rapid7 claims is a patch bypass for multiple CVEs with the same underlying issue which I believe is "permission check for ProgramExport and EntitySQLProcessor") resulted in more exploitation attempts.

References:

  • CVE-2024-32113 (9.1 critical, disclosed 09 May 2024, added to KEV Catalog 07 August 2024) Apache OFBiz Path Traversal Vulnerability
  • CVE-2024-45195 (7.5 high, disclosed 04 September 2024 by Apache) Apache OFBiz remote code execution

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-06T18:10:15.000Z ##

Rapid7: CVE-2024-45195: Apache OFBiz Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution (Fixed)
Rapid7 provides vulnerability details for CVE-2024-45195 (7.5 high, disclosed 04 September 2024 by Apache) Apache OFBiz remote code execution. They claim that CVE-2024-32113, CVE-2024-36104, and CVE-2024-38856 are essentially the same vulnerability with the same root cause. CVE-2024-45195 is a patch bypass for all of those CVEs: “the underlying problem, the ability to fragment the controller-view map state, was not resolved” … “the ability to desynchronize the controller and view map state.” Rapid7 describes the exploitation process. The timeline shows the vulnerability disclosure process and confirmation of patch efficacy.
See related @BleepingComputer reporting: Apache fixes critical OFBiz remote code execution vulnerability

#apache #ofbiz #vulnerability #CVE_2024_45195 #CVE_2024_32113 #CVE_2024_36104 #CVE_2024_38856

### Summary Multiple OGC request parameters allow Remote Code Execution (RCE) by unauthenticated users through specially crafted input against a default GeoServer installation due to unsafely evaluating property names as XPath expressions. ### Details The GeoTools library API that GeoServer calls evaluates property/attribute names for feature types in a way that unsafely passes them to the common

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-05T14:55:36.000Z ##

Fortinet Threat Actors Exploit GeoServer Vulnerability CVE-2024-36401
References:

  • CVE-2024-36401 (9.8 critical, disclosed 01 July 2024, added to CISA KEV Catalog 15 July 2024) OSGeo GeoServer GeoTools Eval Injection Vulnerability
  • CVE-2017-17215 (8.8 high) Huawei HG532 RCE

Fortinet observed multiple campaigns targeting CVE-2024-36401, including a malicious tool called GOREVERSE that often functions as a reverse proxy server. SideWalk is a Linux backdoor often linked with the hacking group APT41. There's also a Mirai botnet variant called JenX (This malware has a credential list for brute-force attacks and a hard-coded payload related to the Huawei router vulnerability CVE-2017-17215), the Condi botnet, and several CoinMiner cryptomining operations. Indicators of compromise listed.

#threatintel #CVE_2024_36401 #GeoServer #GOREVERSE #IOC #infosec #cybersecurity #eitw #vulnerability #cryptomining

screaminggoat at 2024-09-06T18:10:15.059Z ##

Rapid7: CVE-2024-45195: Apache OFBiz Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution (Fixed)
Rapid7 provides vulnerability details for CVE-2024-45195 (7.5 high, disclosed 04 September 2024 by Apache) Apache OFBiz remote code execution. They claim that CVE-2024-32113, CVE-2024-36104, and CVE-2024-38856 are essentially the same vulnerability with the same root cause. CVE-2024-45195 is a patch bypass for all of those CVEs: “the underlying problem, the ability to fragment the controller-view map state, was not resolved” … “the ability to desynchronize the controller and view map state.” Rapid7 describes the exploitation process. The timeline shows the vulnerability disclosure process and confirmation of patch efficacy.
See related @BleepingComputer reporting: Apache fixes critical OFBiz remote code execution vulnerability

#apache #ofbiz #vulnerability #CVE_2024_45195 #CVE_2024_32113 #CVE_2024_36104 #CVE_2024_38856

https://ofbiz.apache.org/download.html

Rapid7 provides vulnerability details for CVE-2024-45195 (7.5 high, disclosed 04 September 2024 by Apache) Apache OFBiz remote code execution. They claim that CVE-2024-32113, CVE-2024-36104, and CVE-2024-38856 are essentially the same vulnerability with the same root cause. CVE-2024-45195 is a patch bypass for all of those CVEs: “the underlying problem, the ability to fragment the controller-view map state, was not resolved” … “the ability to desynchronize the controller and view map state.” Rapid7 describes the exploitation process. CVE-2024-6387
(8.1 HIGH)

EPSS: 0.39%

updated 2024-07-30T03:31:55

2 posts

A signal handler race condition was found in OpenSSH's server (sshd), where a client does not authenticate within LoginGraceTime seconds (120 by default, 600 in old OpenSSH versions), then sshd's SIGALRM handler is called asynchronously. However, this signal handler calls various functions that are not async-signal-safe, for example, syslog().

1 repos

#search_error

faker at 2024-09-09T15:07:16.551Z ##

It's always amazing how terrible some Nessus checks are.
It's like they never even heard of backported security patches.

Oh, your OpenSSH server reports 'OpenSSH_8.9p1 Ubuntu-3ubuntu0.10'? Well, 8.9 is clearly smaller than 9.8 so you MUST be vulnerable to CVE-2024-6387!

And sometimes I get it, the version just appears as outdated. But Ubuntu even includes enough information in the version string to make it possible to detect it automatically as fully patched.

##
faker@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-09T15:07:16.000Z ##

It's always amazing how terrible some Nessus checks are.
It's like they never even heard of backported security patches.

Oh, your OpenSSH server reports 'OpenSSH_8.9p1 Ubuntu-3ubuntu0.10'? Well, 8.9 is clearly smaller than 9.8 so you MUST be vulnerable to CVE-2024-6387!

And sometimes I get it, the version just appears as outdated. But Ubuntu even includes enough information in the version string to make it possible to detect it automatically as fully patched.

screaminggoat at 2024-09-10T16:50:59.075Z ##

ESET: CosmicBeetle steps up: Probation period at RansomHub
ESET reports on CosmicBeetle, a financially-motivated threat actor which targets small to medium businesses (SMB) worldwide, assessed with medium confidence to be a new affiliate of RansomHub Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) as well as Lockbit. CosmicBeetle remains active in 2024, continually improving and distributing its custom ransomware, ScRansom. ESET provides a technical analysis of the ransomware sample, emphasizing that it is impossible to restore some encrypted files. CosmicBeetle has been experimenting with the leaked LockBit builder and has been trying to abuse its brand. ESET helpfully lists out vulnerabilities exploited by this threat actor:

  • CVE-2017-0144 (aka EternalBlue)
  • CVE-2023-27532 (a vulnerability in a Veeam Backup & Replication component)
  • CVE-2021-42278 and CVE-2021-42287 (AD privilege escalation vulnerabilities) through noPac
  • CVE-2022-42475 (a vulnerability in FortiOS SSL-VPN)
  • CVE-2020-1472 (aka Zerologon)

IOC provided. See related The Hacker News reporting: CosmicBeetle Deploys Custom ScRansom Ransomware, Partnering with RansomHub

#threatintel #cosmicbeetle #vulnerability #eitw #ransomware #infosec #IOC #ransomhub #lockbit #raas #ScRansom #cybersecurity

##
jbhall56 at 2024-09-10T12:13:48.981Z ##

The gang uses custom tools known as the Spacecolon malware family, and deploys them after gaining access to a network through brute-force methods as well as exploiting older vulnerabilities like EternalBlue (CVE-2017-0144) or ZeroLogon (CVE-2020-1472). https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/noname-ransomware-gang-deploying-ransomhub-malware-in-recent-attacks/

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-10T16:50:59.000Z ##

ESET: CosmicBeetle steps up: Probation period at RansomHub
ESET reports on CosmicBeetle, a financially-motivated threat actor which targets small to medium businesses (SMB) worldwide, assessed with medium confidence to be a new affiliate of RansomHub Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) as well as Lockbit. CosmicBeetle remains active in 2024, continually improving and distributing its custom ransomware, ScRansom. ESET provides a technical analysis of the ransomware sample, emphasizing that it is impossible to restore some encrypted files. CosmicBeetle has been experimenting with the leaked LockBit builder and has been trying to abuse its brand. ESET helpfully lists out vulnerabilities exploited by this threat actor:

  • CVE-2017-0144 (aka EternalBlue)
  • CVE-2023-27532 (a vulnerability in a Veeam Backup & Replication component)
  • CVE-2021-42278 and CVE-2021-42287 (AD privilege escalation vulnerabilities) through noPac
  • CVE-2022-42475 (a vulnerability in FortiOS SSL-VPN)
  • CVE-2020-1472 (aka Zerologon)

IOC provided. See related The Hacker News reporting: CosmicBeetle Deploys Custom ScRansom Ransomware, Partnering with RansomHub

#threatintel #cosmicbeetle #vulnerability #eitw #ransomware #infosec #IOC #ransomhub #lockbit #raas #ScRansom #cybersecurity

##
jbhall56@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-10T12:13:48.000Z ##

The gang uses custom tools known as the Spacecolon malware family, and deploys them after gaining access to a network through brute-force methods as well as exploiting older vulnerabilities like EternalBlue (CVE-2017-0144) or ZeroLogon (CVE-2020-1472). https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/noname-ransomware-gang-deploying-ransomhub-malware-in-recent-attacks/

CVE-2024-36991
(7.5 HIGH)

updated 2024-07-22T15:32:36

1 posts

In Splunk Enterprise on Windows versions below 9.2.2, 9.1.5, and 9.0.10, an attacker could perform a path traversal on the /modules/messaging/ endpoint in Splunk Enterprise on Windows. This vulnerability should only affect Splunk Enterprise on Windows.

psytester at 2024-09-14T13:08:03.630Z ##

Splunk Windows Path Traversal CVE-2024-36991 not only works on "/modules/messaging/" endpoint in vulnerable versions.
All module names located in /opt/splunk/share/splunk/search_mrsparkle/modules/ are usable.
--> Root entry points "/modules/nav/" and "/modules/paginator/" are working as well.
Fully unauthenticated access according to its CVSS score. 👍

screaminggoat at 2024-09-06T18:10:15.059Z ##

Rapid7: CVE-2024-45195: Apache OFBiz Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution (Fixed)
Rapid7 provides vulnerability details for CVE-2024-45195 (7.5 high, disclosed 04 September 2024 by Apache) Apache OFBiz remote code execution. They claim that CVE-2024-32113, CVE-2024-36104, and CVE-2024-38856 are essentially the same vulnerability with the same root cause. CVE-2024-45195 is a patch bypass for all of those CVEs: “the underlying problem, the ability to fragment the controller-view map state, was not resolved” … “the ability to desynchronize the controller and view map state.” Rapid7 describes the exploitation process. The timeline shows the vulnerability disclosure process and confirmation of patch efficacy.
See related @BleepingComputer reporting: Apache fixes critical OFBiz remote code execution vulnerability

#apache #ofbiz #vulnerability #CVE_2024_45195 #CVE_2024_32113 #CVE_2024_36104 #CVE_2024_38856

##
patchnow24x7 at 2024-09-06T05:22:46.584Z ##

CVE-2024-45195 :: Forced Browsing vulnerability in Apache OfBiz.. #PatchNOW

Advisory:

https://lists.apache.org/thread/o90dd9lbk1hh3t2557t2y2qvrh92p7wy

https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/OFBIZ-13130

RApid7 Blog:

https://www.rapid7.com/blog/post/2024/09/05/cve-2024-45195-apache-ofbiz-unauthenticated-remote-code-execution-fixed/

Patch Download and Release Information:

https://ofbiz.apache.org/download.html

Note: This is a patch bypass for PREVIOUSLY EXPLOITED vulnerabilities like CVE-2024-32113, CVE-2024-36104 and CVE-2024-38856.

#vulnerability
#Apache
#Vulnerability

#infosec

#cybersecurity

##
screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-06T18:10:15.000Z ##

Rapid7: CVE-2024-45195: Apache OFBiz Unauthenticated Remote Code Execution (Fixed)
Rapid7 provides vulnerability details for CVE-2024-45195 (7.5 high, disclosed 04 September 2024 by Apache) Apache OFBiz remote code execution. They claim that CVE-2024-32113, CVE-2024-36104, and CVE-2024-38856 are essentially the same vulnerability with the same root cause. CVE-2024-45195 is a patch bypass for all of those CVEs: “the underlying problem, the ability to fragment the controller-view map state, was not resolved” … “the ability to desynchronize the controller and view map state.” Rapid7 describes the exploitation process. The timeline shows the vulnerability disclosure process and confirmation of patch efficacy.
See related @BleepingComputer reporting: Apache fixes critical OFBiz remote code execution vulnerability

#apache #ofbiz #vulnerability #CVE_2024_45195 #CVE_2024_32113 #CVE_2024_36104 #CVE_2024_38856

CVE-2024-4863
(6.4 MEDIUM)

EPSS: 0.04%

updated 2024-06-14T09:31:24

2 posts

The Gutenberg Blocks with AI by Kadence WP – Page Builder Features plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Stored Cross-Site Scripting via the ‘titleFont’ parameter in all versions up to, and including, 3.2.38 due to insufficient input sanitization and output escaping. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Contributor-level access and above, to inject arbitrary web scripts in page

screaminggoat at 2024-09-10T15:10:50.860Z ##

At least 10 Fortinet security advisories. Happy #PatchTuesday from Fortinet:

  • FG-IR-22-256 CVE-2024-36511 (CVSSv3.1: 3.7 low) Cookie security policy bypass
  • FG-IR-22-282 CVE-2024-31489 (CVSSv3.1: 6.8 medium) FortiClient - Lack of client-side certificate validation in ZTNA service
  • FG-IR-22-230 CVE-2022-45856 (CVSSv3.1: 4.8 medium) FortiClient(All) - Lack of client-side certificate validation using SAML SSO
  • FG-IR-23-204 CVE-2023-44254 (CVSSv3.1: 5.0 medium) IDOR on download logs feature
  • FG-IR-24-123 CVE-2024-33508 (CVSSv3.1: 7.3 high) Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in a Command in DAS component
  • FG-IR-24-048 CVE-2024-4863 (CVSSv3.1: 7.5 high) Inadequate user validation and no brute force protection on change password requests
  • FG-IR-23-362 CVE-2024-21753 (CVSSv3.1: 5.5 medium) Multiple path traversal in administrative interface
  • FG-IR-24-051 CVE-2024-31490 (CVSSv3.1: 4.3 medium) Sensitive files disclosure in diagnostic logs download
  • FG-IR-24-139 CVE-2024-35282 (CVSSv3.1: 4.2 medium) Unencrypted keychain permanent password
  • FG-IR-24-371 CVE-2024-45323 (CVSSv3.1: 4.3 medium) access to backend information and logs via RestAPI on shared environments

No mention of exploitation. Please note that Fortinet skews their displayed CVSS score (temporal) instead of showing base score, downplaying their severity. Read through these yourself to determine the best course of action

#fortinet #vulnerability #cve #fortios #forticlient

screaminggoat@infosec.exchange at 2024-09-10T15:10:50.000Z ##

At least 10 Fortinet security advisories. Happy #PatchTuesday from Fortinet:

  • FG-IR-22-256 CVE-2024-36511 (CVSSv3.1: 3.7 low) Cookie security policy bypass
  • FG-IR-22-282 CVE-2024-31489 (CVSSv3.1: 6.8 medium) FortiClient - Lack of client-side certificate validation in ZTNA service
  • FG-IR-22-230 CVE-2022-45856 (CVSSv3.1: 4.8 medium) FortiClient(All) - Lack of client-side certificate validation using SAML SSO
  • FG-IR-23-204 CVE-2023-44254 (CVSSv3.1: 5.0 medium) IDOR on download logs feature
  • FG-IR-24-123 CVE-2024-33508 (CVSSv3.1: 7.3 high) Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in a Command in DAS component
  • FG-IR-24-048 CVE-2024-4863 (CVSSv3.1: 7.5 high) Inadequate user validation and no brute force protection on change password requests
  • FG-IR-23-362 CVE-2024-21753 (CVSSv3.1: 5.5 medium) Multiple path traversal in administrative interface
  • FG-IR-24-051 CVE-2024-31490 (CVSSv3.1: 4.3 medium) Sensitive files disclosure in diagnostic logs download
  • FG-IR-24-139 CVE-2024-35282 (CVSSv3.1: 4.2 medium) Unencrypted keychain permanent password
  • FG-IR-24-371 CVE-2024-45323 (CVSSv3.1: 4.3 medium) access to backend information and logs via RestAPI on shared environments

No mention of exploitation. Please note that Fortinet skews their displayed CVSS score (temporal) instead of showing base score, downplaying their severity. Read through these yourself to determine the best course of action

joxean@mastodon.social at 2024-09-06T08:34:35.000Z ##

I have just stumbled upon this post diffing some windows driver:

https://www.crowdfense.com/windows-wi-fi-driver-rce-vulnerability-cve-2024-30078/

Why use #BinDiff and see this [first picture] when you can use #Diaphora and see this [second picture]?

Of course, feel free to use whatever tool you prefer but, what's the point of doing more work? Diaphora finds out that only 2 functions are interesting for patch diffing and shows exactly, in the pseudo-code, what new chunk of code was added and what new function is being called. Diffing decompilation.
